  • Posibilidad de incorporación finalizado el convenio de prácticas.

Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capitole Consulting is growing, and we want you to be part of it!

We are looking for a Tableau Data Analyst




Requirements:

Experience Level: minimum 2 years in an analytical role and proficiency in English.




Technical Skills:

Tableau proficiency: experience in creating dashboards and visualizations, including advanced features like calculated fields, parameters, and actions.
Strong SQL skills: ability to query, manage, and analyze large datasets.
Solid understanding of data structures, relational databases, and ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




Daily Responsibilities:

Use SQL to query databases, extract and prepare clean datasets for analysis and reporting.
Update and enhance Tableau dashboards to ensure accuracy, functionality, and relevance for stakeholders.
Generate and distribute automated reports, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide data-driven insights to support business decisions.
Validate data accuracy in dashboards and reports, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability across all outputs.
Collaborate with teams to understand their data needs, provide insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.
Continuously refine SQL queries, Tableau workflows, and reporting processes while staying up to date with industry best practices and new tools.




Why Join Us?

We are amazing, but with you, we’ll be even better! 😊

Benefits:

€1,200 training budget to use on tech events, books, certifications, or courses of your choice.
Monthly team check-ins for continuous feedback.
Flexible working hours to balance your professional and personal life.
Private health insurance, fully covered by Capitole.
Flexible compensation options (meal vouchers, transport, daycare).
Andjoy (Gymforless) membership.
Exclusive employee discounts at top brands through Club Capitole.

Team Culture & Social Perks:

Team buildings every two months – don’t miss our Summer Party or Christmas Dinner!
Capitole-sponsored football team.
Tech communities to share knowledge and ideas across teams – internal knowledge sharing is key! 😃

Want to know more about us?

🌐 Check us out: https://capitole-consulting.com/ ⭐ See what employees say: Glassdoor Reviews

Don’t hesitate to send us your profile – we’re excited to meet you! 🚀

HTML:
Capitole Consulting is growing, and we want you to be part of it!

We are looking for a Tableau Data Analyst


Requirements:

  • Experience Level: minimum 2 years in an analytical role and proficiency in English.


Technical Skills:

  • Tableau proficiency: experience in creating dashboards and visualizations, including advanced features like calculated fields, parameters, and actions.
  • Strong SQL skills: ability to query, manage, and analyze large datasets.
  • Solid understanding of data structures, relational databases, and ETL processes.
  • Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R (a plus).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Daily Responsibilities:

  • Use SQL to query databases, extract and prepare clean datasets for analysis and reporting.
  • Update and enhance Tableau dashboards to ensure accuracy, functionality, and relevance for stakeholders.
  • Generate and distribute automated reports, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide data-driven insights to support business decisions.
  • Validate data accuracy in dashboards and reports, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability across all outputs.
  • Collaborate with teams to understand their data needs, provide insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.
  • Continuously refine SQL queries, Tableau workflows, and reporting processes while staying up to date with industry best practices and new tools.


Why Join Us?

We are amazing, but with you, we’ll be even better! 😊

Benefits:

  • €1,200 training budget to use on tech events, books, certifications, or courses of your choice.
  • Monthly team check-ins for continuous feedback.
  • Flexible working hours to balance your professional and personal life.
  • Private health insurance, fully covered by Capitole.
  • Flexible compensation options (meal vouchers, transport, daycare).
  • Andjoy (Gymforless) membership.
  • Exclusive employee discounts at top brands through Club Capitole.

Team Culture & Social Perks:

  • Team buildings every two months – don’t miss our Summer Party or Christmas Dinner!
  • Capitole-sponsored football team.
  • Tech communities to share knowledge and ideas across teams – internal knowledge sharing is key! 😃

Don’t hesitate to send us your profile – we’re excited to meet you! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Resumen del puesto

Desde la división de IT de WeHunt, estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con Tableau, en la zona de Catalunya para un cliente multinacional.




Descripción del puesto de trabajo

Trabajarás en un entorno tecnológico y en un proyecto a largo plazo que te garantiza estabilidad.
Experiencia en herramientas de visualización, pero que vaya más allá de solo diseñar dashboards
Visión crítica sobre la visualización de datos y que tenga la capacidad de evaluar migraciones o cambios, ofreciendo recomendaciones sobre la mejor forma de implementación y sus posibles impactos.
Liderarás la elaboración de informes para la posterior toma de decisiones, además de poder presentarlo a los equipos de negocio.
Buscamos un gestor de la herramienta, con un sólido conocimiento técnico.




Perfil buscado (H/M/D)

3-4 años de experiencia como Data Analyst (imprescindible)
Conocimientos sólidos en SQL, Tableau y/o Power BI.
Buen nivel de inglés hablado y escrito.




Qué ofrecemos

Modalidad de trabajo híbrida: 1 día en oficina y cuatro días en remoto a la semana.
Horario flexible, de lunes a jueves 8h, viernes 7h.
Jornada intensiva durante las vísperas de festivo y los meses de Julio y Agosto.
Contrato indefinido, con proyecto de larga duración.
Rango salarial competitivo (hasta 38.000€/anuales)




Siguientes pasos

El proceso contará con 2 fases:

Entrevista con el Responsable técnico de la empresa.
Entrevista con un compañero del equipo.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

Quantion es una empresa de servicios de transformación digital.

Nacimos el año 2015 con una misión muy clara: crear una propuesta de valor completa para abordar todos los retos de negocio y tecnológicos que surgen en los procesos de transformación de las empresas.




Ofrecemos un modelo de servicio diferencial a través de la cual acompañamos a las empresas para abordar sus proyectos de transformación digital de forma end-to-end:




Estrategia de transformación digital.
Innovation Scouting.
Asesoramiento tecnológico.
Diseño visual y Experiencia de Usuario.
Desarrollo completo de soluciones de negocio con squads especializados.




Buscamos un perfil Data Analyst con 2-3 años de experiencia para ampliar nuestro equipazo.




Requisitos:

Experiencia con Tableau (principalmente) y opcionalmente PowerBI.
Experiencia con Python (Apache Spark), Databricks y Azure.
Experiencia con Google Analytics y Looker Studio (software de visualización de google).
SQL
Kibana (valorable)




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido
Nuestra vida fuera del trabajo es muy importante, por eso tenemos un horario flexible de entrada y salida que facilita el equilibrio entre la vida personal y profesional.
Trabajo híbrido (flexible)
Comprometidas y comprometidos con la igualdad, En Quantion creemos en la diversidad e inclusión. Defendemos la igualdad de oportunidades sin discriminar por género, edad, religión ni orientación sexual o por cualquier otro aspecto que pudiera ser considerado excluyente.
Plan de retribución flexible




Ah, ¡y algo muy importante!:

Además de los 22 días laborables de vacaciones, contamos con una serie de festivos adicionales:

Semana Santa: días comprendidos entre el Lunes Santo y el Lunes de Pascua (ambos inclusive)
Navidad: días comprendidos entre Navidad y Año Nuevo.




Tiempo de sobra para disfrutar de la familia, amigos y del tiempo libre :)

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what’s right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

In this role, you will work closely with a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to source, analyze, and visualize data from various internal teams and systems. You will transform complex datasets into easy-to-understand, actionable insights, helping our marketing team and executives make informed decisions. Your role will include collaboration with multiple teams and the ability to explain data trends, limitations, and strategic implications effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Data Sourcing & Integration:


Interface with cross-functional teams, including Measurement, Insights & Data Science, MAP market share and Category teams, Finance, Media, Customer Experience, and others, to gather relevant data.
Combine and harmonize data from multiple sources to create comprehensive datasets for analysis.


Data Analysis & Insight Generation


Conduct thorough analyses to detect and interpret trends and patterns, with a focus on deriving actionable insights from performance metrics, competitive intelligence, and evolving market trends.
Transform these insights into strategic recommendations to propel forward our marketing strategies and adapt to competitive pressures and market dynamics.


Visualization & Reporting


Develop and refine visualizations, dashboards, and comprehensive reports that clearly articulate complex data sets. Ensure these tools not only convey information effectively but also facilitate strategic decision-making, thereby enhancing marketing initiatives and business results.


Stakeholder Communication


Clearly articulate data findings, limitations, and implications to non-technical stakeholders, including marketing teams and executive leadership.
Assist the Senior Data Analyst in preparing and delivering presentations to internal teams and executives.


Qualifications & Skills

Education and Experience Required:


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
4-7 years of work experience, preferably in marketing, data analytics, market research, customer research or customer experience strategy, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience


Technical Skills


Proficiency in both Excel and Power Point, experience with data visualization in Power BI and SQL.
Familiarity with marketing analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) is a plus.


Soft Skills


Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Clear and concise communication skills, with the ability to explain data findings to non-technical audiences.
Attention to detail and a proactive approach to tasks.

Title: Data Analyst - Fraud & Payments
Description:
Who we are 




We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 6 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.




Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

Your Mission 


As a Data Analyst, you will be a key part of the Operational Excellence team, helping to enhance and streamline our processes to ensure efficiency, automation, and scalability at Bitpanda. In this role, you will play a strategic and collaborative role in monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing business operations—primarily within Payments and Risk Operations. By generating valuable insights, identifying opportunities for improvement, and ensuring data integrity, you will help shape key decisions that drive real impact. This isn’t just a BI Analyst role focused on reporting—you will be a trusted partner and problem-solver, working alongside teams to uncover trends, enhance performance, and create meaningful solutions.


What You’ll Do 



Keep a pulse on key business metrics – Develop and maintain reports that provide actionable insights to leadership (daily, weekly, and monthly).


Champion data integrity & accessibility – Work closely with product and data engineering teams to enhance data quality and ensure seamless availability.


Implement smart alerts & anomaly detection – Set up automated alerts to proactively detect any issues or trends impacting payment performance.


Drive strategic impact  – Collaborate with the Payments team to develop and deliver data-driven recommendations that enhance performance and efficiency.



Who You Are 



Hold a Master’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Finance, or a related field.


Relevant experience as a process/product analyst, ideally within Risk & Payments.


Skilled in SQL, Python, and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Metabase, Power BI), with experience working with large datasets


A natural problem-solver who loves transforming complex data into clear, impactful insights through reports and dashboards.


Proactive and solutions-focused, always looking for ways to optimize processes and drive meaningful improvements.



What’s in it for you





We're proud of our flexible working model that includes 2 days (minimum) working from the local Hub, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually


Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan


Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy


Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!


Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand





And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.




Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
Show more
HTML:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.

  • Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
  • Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
  • Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
  • Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
  • Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company


Your work environment:

  • Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
  • A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
  • Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!


Who You Are:

  • At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
  • A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
  • Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
  • Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
  • Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
  • You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
  • Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
  • Fluent in English
  • Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Continua nuestro legado y tradición: ¡únete a Europastry!

Formar parte del equipo Europastry supone querer continuar y evolucionar un legado y una tradición llevándolos a otro nivel. Significa ser un Baker y aportar un talento y valor únicos.

Europastry es un proyecto apasionante que mira al futuro sin perder de vista el pasado. Respetamos nuestros orígenes aprovechando el know-how adquirido durante casi cuatro décadas y, al mismo tiempo, tenemos la libertad y la pasión de reinventarnos e innovar cada día.

Somos una empresa global con presencia en más de 80 países donde diariamente cerca de 5.000 Bakers lideran el mercado de masas congeladas de panadería y bollería. Somos un equipo de valientes que arriesgamos, hacemos que las cosas pasen, y nos esforzamos por ofrecer el mejor producto a nuestros consumidores a través del mejor servicio a nuestros partners.

Somos #Brave #Agile #Keen #Engaged

We are Bakers. ¿Y tú?

Tu misión en pocas palabras

Buscamos un profesional para liderar la integración de nuevos negocios y adquisiciones en nuestro ecosistema de BI. Esta persona desempeñará un papel clave en la transformación de datos, impulsando la calidad y gobernanza de datos en colaboración con diversas áreas de la organización. Buscamos un perfil con visión de negocio, capaz de comprender los procesos empresariales y alinear las soluciones de datos con los objetivos y estrategias corporativas.

¿Cómo sería tu día a día?


Actuar como enlace entre los nuevos negocios y los departamentos internos para homogeneizar datos según estándares corporativos.
Coordinar la integración de datos y procesos de negocio en cubos de BI (Tableau), proporcionando formación y soporte a los usuarios.
Supervisar la calidad de los datos, implementando controles y revisando la precisión de los informes.
Diseñar y ejecutar una estrategia de gestión de datos maestros y gobierno de datos para garantizar la integridad, consistencia y seguridad.
Promover alianzas transversales con líderes de negocio, TI y usuarios de datos para comprender sus necesidades.


Que buscamos en un/a Baker


Grado o Master en ADE, Economía, Ingeniería, Estadística o estudios relacionados.
Experiencia previa en un rol de análisis de datos o BI, de mínimo 1 año, y previa en una posición similar de un mínimo de 3 años.
Conocimiento de herramientas de BI (particularmente Tableau), bases de datos y herramientas de integración y transformación de datos (ETL).
Se valorará experiencia y conocimiento del entorno JD Edwards. y de los principios y mejores prácticas de calidad de datos.
Autonomía, iniciativa y proactividad para liderar proyectos y proponer mejoras de manera constante.
Capacidad de organización y meticulosidad, el cumplimiento de deadlines gestionando múltiples tareas de forma simultánea, así como una alta capacidad analítica.
Un mínimo de un 25% del tiempo el rol se ejercerá directamente en los negocios adquiridos, que pueden ser tanto nacionales como internacionales.


¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo?


Oportunidades para el crecimiento profesional dentro de un equipo internacional.
Plan de compensación flexible que incluye seguro de salud, guardería, transporte y comida, adaptado a tus necesidades. Además, incluye un seguro para tu mascota,
Acceso exclusivo a la plataforma Bakers Vip Club, con descuentos en ocio y consumo solo para nuestros colaboradores.
Subvención en el menú de cantina, para que disfrutes de la comida a un coste reducido.
Desayuno Europastry: ¡Empieza tu día con nuestros mejores productos!
Descuento exclusivo para empleados en nuestros productos de Europastry.
¡Acceso a gimnasio y pistas de pádel del recinto para mantener tu bienestar físico!
Viernes tarde con horario intensivo.
Lockers disponibles en el edificio, donde puedes recibir tus pedidos en cualquier momento.


En Europastry, ofrecemos un espacio de trabajo diverso e inclusivo donde todas las personas se sientan valoradas y respetadas. Estamos comprometidos con prácticas de contratación justas y equitativas, implementamos programas de formación para asegurar que toda nuestra plantilla conozca y esté comprometida con estos principios.

Estamos interesados en el valor único que puedes aportar a nuestro equipo, independientemente de cualquier otro aspecto. Por favor, envía un CV que destaque tus logros profesionales y habilidades. No es necesario incluir fotografías ni datos personales que no sean relevantes para la evaluación de tu candidatura.

¿Te gustaría ser Baker?
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analysts at Thoughtworks collect, process and analyze large datasets to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making for our clients. They are responsible for the strategy, implementation, productionization and articulation of business impact. They collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. They stay up-to-date with industry advancements, ensure data quality and security, and actively mentor other Thoughtworkers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.

Job responsibilities


You will perform data extraction and modeling to generate insights and make recommendations for the business.
You will support the definition and construction of KPIs that best represent the business performance of our clients, assisting in decision-making processes.
You will work on the development and maintenance of strategic dashboards, reports and KPIs.
You will use storytelling practices for effective dashboard construction.
You will build solutions and validate hypotheses through comprehensive data analysis.
You will design, conduct and measure both qualitative and quantitative research.
You will create proposals and conduct A/B tests.
You will conduct ad-hoc studies as needed.
You will connect with stakeholders to understand database structures, apply necessary business rules and share analysis methods and methodologies.



Job Qualifications

Technical Skills


You have expertise with Tableau as a self-service BI tool.
You have experience in analytics and business intelligence projects.
You have proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets.
You have strong data visualization practices with relevant tools.
You have proficiency in database management, either relational or non-relational.
You have advanced knowledge in SQL and Python.
You have ability to clean, prepare and analyze big data, both structured and unstructured.
You have exploratory, qualitative and quantitative analysis skills.
You have experience with research techniques and satisfaction indicators.
You have ability to identify patterns, actionable insights and relationships in data.



Professional Skills


You have great stakeholder management skills and you are able to build rapport and gain buy-in from clients and key stakeholders.
You are a great problem solver, thrive in ambiguity, tackle challenges from various angles and embrace risk management.
You have a data-driven approach, seeking opportunities to leverage data for efficiency and value, and actively collaborate to drive data-based decisions.
You are a great communicator and have the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
You are a team player and actively collaborate with colleagues and other teams.
You are eager to coach, mentor and motivate others and you aspire to influence teammates to take positive action and accountability for their work.
English and Spanish communication and relationship building skills – written, verbal, facilitation, etc, are a must.



Other things to know

Learning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a dynamic and inclusive community of bright and supportive colleagues who are revolutionizing tech. As a leading technology consultancy, we’re pushing boundaries through our purposeful and impactful work. For 30+ years, we’ve delivered extraordinary impact together with our clients by helping them solve complex business problems with technology as the differentiator. Bring your brilliant expertise and commitment for continuous learning to Thoughtworks. Together, let’s be extraordinary.


Show more

Title: Junior data analyst - data migration team
Description:
Junior data analyst - Equipo de migración de datos

Sobre El Puesto

Buscamos un/a Junior Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de migración de datos en el sector educativo. Esta persona será responsable de apoyar en procesos de ETL (extracción, transformación y carga de datos), análisis de información y validación de datos en sistemas ERP.

Responsabilidades


Colaborar en la recopilación, limpieza y validación de datos para garantizar su integridad y calidad.
Ejecutar procesos de migración de datos y dar soporte en tareas de ETL.
Analizar ficheros de datos para identificar errores, inconsistencias o duplicados.
Generar informes y dashboards para evaluar la migración y detectar posibles mejoras.
Colaborar con el equipo técnico en la optimización de procesos de migración.
Documentar los procedimientos y metodologías utilizadas en la gestión de datos.
Apoyar en la automatización de procesos y en la mejora continua de la migración de datos.


Requisitos


Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos o campos relacionados.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos (prácticas o roles junior).
Conocimientos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales.
Habilidad en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Conocimientos básicos de Python o R para el análisis y manipulación de datos.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y resolución de problemas.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.
Nivel intermedio de inglés y fluidez en catalán/español.


Ofrecemos


Contrato indefinido y modelo de trabajo híbrido en Barcelona.
Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
Oportunidades de formación y crecimiento profesional.
Programa de beneficios flexibles


About Sanoma Learning

How do you prepare students for the world, engage their curiosity and inspire them to grow? That is the main question of teachers all around the world. At Sanoma Learning, it has always been our mission to help to find and develop best-in-class answers to this question. If you join us, it means that you embark on an exciting journey to help shape the future of learning for primary, secondary and vocational education. We believe that your journey is our success as a company.

Sanoma Learning is a leading K12 European learning company, operating in 12 countries. Our learning products and services enable and support teachers and schools to develop the talents of every child to reach their potential. By offering printed and digital learning content, as well as digital learning and teaching platforms for primary, secondary and vocational education, we want to grow our positive impact on learning across Europe. With over 3000 employees, we help shape the future of education for 25+ million of students.

So, are you ready to start your journey to help shape the future of learning and help teachers to support all students to reach their potential?

Sanoma Learning is an equal opportunity employer; we are committed to inclusion and diversity, ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.
Show more
HTML:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
  • Data Analysis & Reporting:
    • Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
    • Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
    • Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
    • Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
  • Collaboration:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
    • Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
  • Data Quality & Governance:
    • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
    • Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.






What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
  • 3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
  • Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
  • Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
  • Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
  • Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.

Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
  • People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
  • MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
  • Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
  • Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
  • Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Business Data Analyst - Pricing
Description:
About Ukio |

Ukio's mission is to empower individuals to live where they want, when they want 🌎.

We do this by disrupting the traditional residential real estate market, providing fully furnished and artfully designed apartments for stays starting at one month. We remove all the hassle around finding a rental with no long-term contracts, moving/buying furniture, security deposits, broker fees, etc. giving choice and flexibility to allow people to live where and when they want. 💥

We are a Barcelona based startup with offices in Madrid, Lisbon, Berlin and Paris! and soon we will conquer some more cities across Europe 🚀

Backed by Europe's best Venture Capital firms, the next year will be a critical phase in our growth as we look to further build out our team and expand into multiple new markets 🔥 . We have successfully raised a Series A investment round that will help propel our growth throughout Western Europe. 🥇

Our Culture |

We honor diversity, compassion, and honesty above all else in our team. We've already got a great mix of dedicated, collaborative, and results-driven people and are looking for more like minded folks to join our team. In true startup fashion, we always embrace the unknown and grant full autonomy to our team members to act as the owners of their projects and tasks. We are creators who embrace dynamic environments and take on and build up projects from scratch.

Our team is composed of everyone from foodies to athletes, adventure seekers to art buffs. We know fun, and we always have a team event on our calendars, so are you ready to join us?

Responsibilities |


Analyze strategies for real estate properties or hospitality services, including short-term rentals, hotels, and long-term leases
Analyze historical data, market trends, and competitor pricing to recommend optimal rates
Collaborate with the Revenue Team to align pricing strategies with business objectives
Build and maintain pricing models using advanced Excel techniques, business intelligence tools, and forecasting software
Generate daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports to track key metrics such as occupancy, average daily rate (ADR), and revenue per available unit (RevPAR)
Conduct scenario analyses to evaluate the impact of pricing changes on revenue and profitability


About you |


Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a related field
2-4 years of experience in pricing, revenue management, or financial analysis within the real estate or hospitality industry
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau
Strong analytical and decision-making skills
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities


Ukio Life Benefits |


Private Health Insurance with ALAN
Flexible retribution with Payflow
UKIO Anniversary gift
Team buildings and office events
Transportation card (transportation coverage for role that have traveling needed for their work tasks according to the internal policy)
Breakfast at the office, fruits, nutrition bars, free coffee/tea and popcorn!
An amazing internal culture and no dress code!
International working environment with many different nationalities!


Ukio's culture promotes and values each individual's contribution. Diversity and inclusion, it's a big topic for us, as such we encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief.

Sky's the limit for us. We're here to revolutionize your life. Be part of this revolution 🔥

We look forward to receiving your application!

For more information about Ukio, visit us at www.ukio.com and to keep up to date with UKIO's news, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast ready to make an impact? Join our team as a Data Analyst, where you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our company’s future through sharp analysis, strategic insight, and proactive collaboration.

Key Responsibilities

Insight Generation & Analytics


Answer business questions using a wide range of data techniques.
Develop concise one-page documents with actionable insights and business recommendations.
Conduct in-depth analyses to solve key business problems.
Translate complex data into clear and concise presentations for senior management and stakeholders, effectively communicating key findings and recommendations.
Create compelling visualizations to effectively communicate key metrics to stakeholders.


Machine Learning & AI


Develop and deploy machine learning models to solve and automate key business problems and processes.
Foster an AI-driven culture within Holaluz by researching and disseminating AI knowledge across the company.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and assess their suitability for Holaluz.


Data Warehousing


Populate the Data Warehouse with datasets using Python and SQL to create robust data pipelines.
Optimize and evolve the data warehousing infrastructure to ensure cost-effectiveness and scalability.
Maintain the smooth and efficient operation of Data Analytics systems.


What We’re Looking For

Education & Experience


A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field
3–5 years of experience working as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Data Engineer.


Key Skills & Attributes


Expertise in SQL and Python language.
Analytical and strategic thinking with a proven ability to solve complex problems.
Good communication skills to distill intricate concepts into actionable insights.
Previous experience working with a visualization tool such as Power BI, QlikView, Tableau, etc.
A proactive, detail-oriented professional with a solution-focused mindset.
Team player who thrives both independently and in collaborative environments.
A positive, energetic attitude that aligns with our SHAKE culture:


○ Say things as they are

○ Have fun

○ Always people first

○ Keep rowing together

○ Es posible

Why Join Us?

This role is more than just a job—it’s an opportunity to drive meaningful impact within a fast-paced, forward-thinking organization. If you’re optimistic, hardworking, and excited to grow within a culture of transparency, collaboration, and possibility, we’d love to hear from you.
Show more

Title: Business Insights Analyst (BI/Data Analyst) 80% remoto
Description:
¿Te interesaría seguir desarrollándote como Business Insights Analyst en una empresa líder del sector relacionado con el turismo?




Desde Oxigent Technologies seleccionamos un/a BUSINESS INSIGHTS ANALYST (BI/Data Analyst) ubicado en Barcelona alrededores.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?

Desarrollar análisis de datos complejos, aplicando distintas metodologías matemáticas y/o estadística.
Liderar informes y/o entregables relacionados con datos relevantes, así como sus presentaciones a los equipos de negocio.
Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos y B.I.).
Llevar a cabo investigaciones cualitativas y cuantitativas y utilizar enfoques de métodos mixtos para el análisis de datos, según necesidades de negocio.




Para ello, ¿qué vas a necesitar?

Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Años de experiencia: mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de negocio o analista de datos.
Idiomas: Inglés (intermedio)
Skills técnicas:
Sólida experiencia en SQL y Python (R como valorable).
Se valorará experiencia en herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Contratación indefinida a través de Oxigent.
Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada (Rango salarial entre 38.000€-42.000€ brutos anuales).
Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y los meses de verano.
Modelo híbrido 80% teletrabajo.
Cheque Formación para desarrollarte en las áreas profesionales que más te interesen.
Seguro médico privado.
Retribución flexible aplicable a seguro médico, restaurante, transporte, guardería y formación.
‍Aplicación de acceso a gimnasios y actividades deportivas en toda España con descuentos.
¡Y muchos otros beneficios!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - WhereTo, Spain
Description:
Hola, 안녕하세요, Salut, Привет!

WhereTo is a business travel startup from San Francisco that evolved into an agile development and design studio within the Flight Centre family. We build travel solutions used by some of the largest companies on the planet - we have just one goal: making business travel better for everybody.

WhereTo provides an AI-powered travel platform for corporate travel. Their platform uses machine learning algorithms to recommend personalized travel options based on a traveler's preferences, company policies, and budget. WhereTo's technology also allows for real-time travel tracking, reporting, and cost analysis, enabling companies to optimize their travel programs and reduce costs.

To learn more about WhereTo click HERE

About Your Opportunity...

If you love data, this job is for you. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to take on the role of Data Analyst. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for advanced data analysis, development of complex reports and dashboards, and providing strategic insights to drive operational performance for our global business. This position requires expertise in data transformation, modeling, and reporting development. Join our fast-paced environment at WhereTo as a Level II Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of travel through data analysis and innovation.

A day in the life...


Develop advanced visual reports, interactive dashboards, and KPI scorecards to provide in-depth insights into operational performance.
Collect and process vast amounts of data from multiple sources, employing advanced data transformation techniques to ensure usability and accuracy.
Generate ad hoc reports, complex datasets, and leverage database or data warehouse queries and scripts to extract information for end-users.
Integrate data from diverse sources and systems to produce comprehensive and requested data elements.
Conduct ad hoc analysis of business data, identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies to support decision-making.
Provide assistance and support to customers, addressing data integrity, validation questions, and resolving related queries.
Analyze data and trends and propose performance improvement measures to optimize operational efficiency.
Collaborate effectively with operations and engineering teams, participating in issue identification, estimation, prioritization, and resolution.
Comfortably operate within the Agile Scrum model, actively contributing to team meetings and sprint planning sessions.
Attend meetings with clients and stakeholders, presenting findings, insights, and recommendations with clarity and professionalism.



Experience & Qualifications...


Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics) or related experience.
Strong communication skills required.
Strong experience working with analytics platforms such as mixpanel or similar required.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Superset, Tableau, etc
Experience with data analytics databases such as Druid.
Demonstrate a deep understanding of data relationships and a mastery of SQL syntax to perform advanced data retrieval and manipulation.
Exhibit exceptional analysis and design skills, critical thinking, and problemsolving abilities to tackle complex business challenges.
Experience in the DAX language, enabling the development of complex calculations and measures within Power BI a plus.
Prior experience working with travel data, understanding the unique challenges and requirements within the industry a plus.
Proficiency in Python or R, enabling advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and machine learning capabilities a plus.



Work Perks! - What’s in it for you...

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.


Our fantastic offices are located in the heart of Barcelona, at Plaça Catalunya.
The opportunity to join our free language lessons (English, French, Spanish or Catalan).
An attractive package: health insurance
25 days off/year + 5 compensation days + reduced time during summer + bank holidays.
Flexible working-time.
Table tennis on the terrace, a kitchen area with free snacks, fresh fruits and drinks.
The opportunity to work with an international and talented team.
Several activities organised by the ambassadors!


#WTO

Title: Data Analyst | Business Insights Specialist
Description:
En BCNC GROUP estamos en la búsqueda de un/a Data Analyst | Business Insights Specialist con más de 3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos y generación de insights estratégicos.

La persona seleccionada formará parte de un equipo dinámico que trabaja para una de las compañías más importantes del sector aéreo.




¿Qué harás?




Analizar datos complejos aplicando metodologías matemáticas y estadísticas para generar información útil para el negocio.
Desarrollar informes, dashboards y visualizaciones con herramientas como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Liderar mesas de trabajo con áreas de negocio para priorizar proyectos y mostrar avances clave.
Aplicar enfoques cualitativos y cuantitativos para resolver problemas y diseñar soluciones basadas en datos.
Ser el enlace técnico entre equipos, promoviendo el uso eficaz de datos y mejores prácticas.




Requisitos:




Mas de 3 años de experiencia en roles de análisis de datos o insights de negocio.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, estadísticas, ingeniería o similares. Máster o MBA, deseable.
Dominio avanzado en SQL, con experiencia en Python (valorable), manejo de Big Data y herramientas BI.
Habilidad para estructurar información, extraer insights y generar visualizaciones efectivas.
Experiencia previa en sectores como aéreo, turismo o viajes será valorada.
Idiomas: Español e Inglés avanzado.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y estabilidad laboral.
80% teletrabajo (un día a la oficina).
Innovación constante: Trabaja con tecnologías de vanguardia y en proyectos de alto impacto.
Crecimiento profesional: Oportunidades continuas de desarrollo y formación.
Ambiente colaborativo: Trabaja en un entorno dinámico y con equipos multidisciplinarios.




¿Te interesa?




En BCNC GROUP somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, UK Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos.

Title: Analista de Negocio (Data Analyst)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Occident, una de las empresas con mayor relevancia en el sector asegurador español, está emprendiendo, desde su departamento de Analítica de Negocio, la transformación de la organización hacia un modelo data-centric.




En este contexto, el departamento de Analítica de Negocio fomenta el desarrollo y la aplicación de modelos de Inteligencia Artificial para la resolución de problemas y mejora de procesos de negocio en la compañía.

Dentro de este departamento, estamos buscando la incorporación de un estudiante con interés en el área de la Inteligencia Artificial con la finalidad de colaborar con el equipo en un rol de analista de negocio. Este rol consistirá en entender las problemáticas de los equipos de negocio de la compañía para encontrar soluciones tecnológicas, basadas en el uso de datos, que ayuden a la mejora de sus procesos.




Requisitos:

Se busca una persona con pensamiento crítico y habilidades para la resolución de problemas.
Persona proactiva, participativa, con capacidad de trabajo en equipo y ganas de aprender dentro de un área en constante evolución.
Capacidad de abstracción y conceptualización de conceptos difusos.
Conocimientos avanzados de estadística/matemáticas
Conocimientos en jurisprudencia y teorías sociológicas para comprender y analizar el impacto de las políticas y regulaciones en el sector asegurador.
Conocimientos básicos de programación (Python/R/SQL recomendables)
Conocimientos básicos de Machine Learning / Deep Learning




Dedicación:

Reflexión y propuesta de ideas para solucionar problemáticas empresariales con el uso de datos y algoritmos de Machine Learning.
Autonomía para conceptualizar problemas en propuestas de datos concretas de aplicación a negocio.
Análisis y derivación de información útil en base a los sistemas de datos de la compañía.
Aplicación y transformación adecuada de la información para alimentar modelos de Machine Learning.
Evaluación tangible de las soluciones de datos propuestas.
Interrelación con diferentes departamentos de la compañía.




La oferta incluye:

Formación en diversos aspectos de Machine Learning.
Formación en aspectos como "Critical Thinking" o "Problem Solving"
Jornada 25 h/semana.
Horario flexible adaptado a las necesidades del estudiante.
Teletrabajo 3 días semanales.
Retribución bruta de 10€/h.
Posibilidad de realizar el TFG/TFM si la colaboración se prolonga más de un semestre.
Posibilidad de incorporación finalizado el convenio de prácticas.

Show more

Title: Internship in Data Analysis and Dashboard Development
Description:
Role Description As an Intern in the EMEA OPS team within the Service Supply Chain (SSC), you will play a key role in enhancing operational visibility by designing and developing data-driven tools and dashboards, primarily using Power BI. Your focus will be on analyzing data and creating user-friendly dashboards that provide live operational insights, helping the team extract meaningful conclusions to improve our parts shipment and repair operations across EMEA.
Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field, with plans to graduate within the next year.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including Power BI.
Knowledge of database systems and experience with data visualization.
Effective communication skills for presenting insights and working collaboratively.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Nice to Have
Experience with programming languages such as Python or SQL.
Familiarity with supply chain operations or logistics processes.
Knowledge of other data visualization tools or advanced features of Power BI.
Previous internship or project experience involving dashboard development.
Interest in gaining practical experience in a dynamic, operations-focused environment.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 6 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash, basketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as “beer bust” Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour – from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let’s talk!

GBU Entity (ES41)

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

• Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

•Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

•Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

•Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

•Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

• SQL advanced

• Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

• Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

• Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

• AWS

• Microsoft Azure cloud computing

• Familiarity with DataOps principles

• Familiar with Agile methodologies

• Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

• You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

• You have good presentation skills.

• You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

• You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

• You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

• You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

Quantion es una empresa de servicios de transformación digital.

Nacimos el año 2015 con una misión muy clara: crear una propuesta de valor completa para abordar todos los retos de negocio y tecnológicos que surgen en los procesos de transformación de las empresas.




Ofrecemos un modelo de servicio diferencial a través de la cual acompañamos a las empresas para abordar sus proyectos de transformación digital de forma end-to-end:




Estrategia de transformación digital.
Innovation Scouting.
Asesoramiento tecnológico.
Diseño visual y Experiencia de Usuario.
Desarrollo completo de soluciones de negocio con squads especializados.




Buscamos un perfil Data Analyst con 2-3 años de experiencia para ampliar nuestro equipazo.




Requisitos:

Experiencia con Tableau (principalmente) y opcionalmente PowerBI.
Experiencia con Python (Apache Spark), Databricks y Azure.
Experiencia con Google Analytics y Looker Studio (software de visualización de google).
SQL
Kibana (valorable)




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido
Nuestra vida fuera del trabajo es muy importante, por eso tenemos un horario flexible de entrada y salida que facilita el equilibrio entre la vida personal y profesional.
Trabajo híbrido (flexible)
Comprometidas y comprometidos con la igualdad, En Quantion creemos en la diversidad e inclusión. Defendemos la igualdad de oportunidades sin discriminar por género, edad, religión ni orientación sexual o por cualquier otro aspecto que pudiera ser considerado excluyente.
Plan de retribución flexible




Ah, ¡y algo muy importante!:

Además de los 22 días laborables de vacaciones, contamos con una serie de festivos adicionales:

Semana Santa: días comprendidos entre el Lunes Santo y el Lunes de Pascua (ambos inclusive)
Navidad: días comprendidos entre Navidad y Año Nuevo.




Tiempo de sobra para disfrutar de la familia, amigos y del tiempo libre :)
