Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what’s right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: RISK/DATA ANALYST ANÁLISIS SECTORIAL Y SEGUIMIENTO DE GRANDES RIESGOS
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El departamento de seguimiento de grandes riesgos tiene como principales proyectos y funciones:

 

Análisis de carteras específicas, tanto a nivel cuantitativo como cualitativo, y realizar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
es).
Análisis y seguimiento sectorial.
Elaboración información mensual para establecer el perímetro de seguimiento de los grupos/empresas de grandes riesgos, así como, asignar su prioridad.
Extracción de información de triggers para la gestión proactiva de los mismos y seguimiento de acreditados individualmente significativos (Single Nam
Proporcionar información para la previsión escenarios de NPLs para perímetro análisis individual.
Participación en procesos de inspecciones supervisoras. 
Gestión de auditorías externa e interna vinculadas al ámbito de análisis individualizado.
Evaluación y gestión proactiva de cambios regulatorios. Análisis de impacto en la cartera crediticia y colaboración en la implantación de procesos que contribuyan al cumplimiento normativo. 
Dar respuesta a peticiones del supervisor referente a información relacionada con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados.
Seguimiento proyectos con sistemas de información para el mantenimiento, mejoras y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos relacionados con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados, grupos económicos, portfolios y sectores.
Descripción del perfil:

 

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulación superior en matemáticas, ingeniería informática o ciencias económicas/empresariales.  Se valorará MBA, FRM o similares.
Inglés hablado y escrito
Se valorará experiencia profesional en el ámbito de Riesgos.
Compromiso con la formación y el desarrollo profesional. 
Capacidad de análisis, rigor y síntesis. 
Espíritu crítico, visión global y estratégica del cliente. 
Entusiasmo, compromiso e implicación en el trabajo. 
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo con habilidades de relación interpersonal.

 

Competencias clave

 

Dominio Office: Excel y power point.
Se valorará muy positivamente el uso de herramienta extracción de datos (SAS Enterprise Guide) y conocimientos en Qlik sense.
Conocimientos del ámbito de riesgos y habilidades técnicas para poder entender y gestionar las necesidades asociadas al análisis de carteras de grandes riesgos, así cómo, buen manejo de los datos asociados para llevar a cabo dichos análisis y elaborar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
Ofrecemos:

  

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

In this role, you will work closely with a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to source, analyze, and visualize data from various internal teams and systems. You will transform complex datasets into easy-to-understand, actionable insights, helping our marketing team and executives make informed decisions. Your role will include collaboration with multiple teams and the ability to explain data trends, limitations, and strategic implications effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Data Sourcing & Integration:


Interface with cross-functional teams, including Measurement, Insights & Data Science, MAP market share and Category teams, Finance, Media, Customer Experience, and others, to gather relevant data.
Combine and harmonize data from multiple sources to create comprehensive datasets for analysis.


Data Analysis & Insight Generation


Conduct thorough analyses to detect and interpret trends and patterns, with a focus on deriving actionable insights from performance metrics, competitive intelligence, and evolving market trends.
Transform these insights into strategic recommendations to propel forward our marketing strategies and adapt to competitive pressures and market dynamics.


Visualization & Reporting


Develop and refine visualizations, dashboards, and comprehensive reports that clearly articulate complex data sets. Ensure these tools not only convey information effectively but also facilitate strategic decision-making, thereby enhancing marketing initiatives and business results.


Stakeholder Communication


Clearly articulate data findings, limitations, and implications to non-technical stakeholders, including marketing teams and executive leadership.
Assist the Senior Data Analyst in preparing and delivering presentations to internal teams and executives.


Qualifications & Skills

Education and Experience Required:


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
4-7 years of work experience, preferably in marketing, data analytics, market research, customer research or customer experience strategy, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience


Technical Skills


Proficiency in both Excel and Power Point, experience with data visualization in Power BI and SQL.
Familiarity with marketing analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) is a plus.


Soft Skills


Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Clear and concise communication skills, with the ability to explain data findings to non-technical audiences.
Attention to detail and a proactive approach to tasks.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Fraud & Payments
Description:
Who we are 




We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 6 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.




Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

Your Mission 


As a Data Analyst, you will be a key part of the Operational Excellence team, helping to enhance and streamline our processes to ensure efficiency, automation, and scalability at Bitpanda. In this role, you will play a strategic and collaborative role in monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing business operations—primarily within Payments and Risk Operations. By generating valuable insights, identifying opportunities for improvement, and ensuring data integrity, you will help shape key decisions that drive real impact. This isn’t just a BI Analyst role focused on reporting—you will be a trusted partner and problem-solver, working alongside teams to uncover trends, enhance performance, and create meaningful solutions.


What You’ll Do 



Keep a pulse on key business metrics – Develop and maintain reports that provide actionable insights to leadership (daily, weekly, and monthly).


Champion data integrity & accessibility – Work closely with product and data engineering teams to enhance data quality and ensure seamless availability.


Implement smart alerts & anomaly detection – Set up automated alerts to proactively detect any issues or trends impacting payment performance.


Drive strategic impact  – Collaborate with the Payments team to develop and deliver data-driven recommendations that enhance performance and efficiency.



Who You Are 



Hold a Master’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Finance, or a related field.


Relevant experience as a process/product analyst, ideally within Risk & Payments.


Skilled in SQL, Python, and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Metabase, Power BI), with experience working with large datasets


A natural problem-solver who loves transforming complex data into clear, impactful insights through reports and dashboards.


Proactive and solutions-focused, always looking for ways to optimize processes and drive meaningful improvements.



What’s in it for you





We're proud of our flexible working model that includes 2 days (minimum) working from the local Hub, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually


Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan


Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy


Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!


Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand





And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.




Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more
HTML:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do


  • Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
  • Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
  • Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
  • Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
  • Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
  • Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
  • at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Strong data visualization skills


Bonus points for:


  • Good knowledge of Python
  • Git knowledge
  • Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Continua nuestro legado y tradición: ¡únete a Europastry!

Formar parte del equipo Europastry supone querer continuar y evolucionar un legado y una tradición llevándolos a otro nivel. Significa ser un Baker y aportar un talento y valor únicos.

Europastry es un proyecto apasionante que mira al futuro sin perder de vista el pasado. Respetamos nuestros orígenes aprovechando el know-how adquirido durante casi cuatro décadas y, al mismo tiempo, tenemos la libertad y la pasión de reinventarnos e innovar cada día.

Somos una empresa global con presencia en más de 80 países donde diariamente cerca de 5.000 Bakers lideran el mercado de masas congeladas de panadería y bollería. Somos un equipo de valientes que arriesgamos, hacemos que las cosas pasen, y nos esforzamos por ofrecer el mejor producto a nuestros consumidores a través del mejor servicio a nuestros partners.

Somos #Brave #Agile #Keen #Engaged

We are Bakers. ¿Y tú?

Tu misión en pocas palabras

Buscamos un profesional para liderar la integración de nuevos negocios y adquisiciones en nuestro ecosistema de BI. Esta persona desempeñará un papel clave en la transformación de datos, impulsando la calidad y gobernanza de datos en colaboración con diversas áreas de la organización. Buscamos un perfil con visión de negocio, capaz de comprender los procesos empresariales y alinear las soluciones de datos con los objetivos y estrategias corporativas.

¿Cómo sería tu día a día?


Actuar como enlace entre los nuevos negocios y los departamentos internos para homogeneizar datos según estándares corporativos.
Coordinar la integración de datos y procesos de negocio en cubos de BI (Tableau), proporcionando formación y soporte a los usuarios.
Supervisar la calidad de los datos, implementando controles y revisando la precisión de los informes.
Diseñar y ejecutar una estrategia de gestión de datos maestros y gobierno de datos para garantizar la integridad, consistencia y seguridad.
Promover alianzas transversales con líderes de negocio, TI y usuarios de datos para comprender sus necesidades.


Que buscamos en un/a Baker


Grado o Master en ADE, Economía, Ingeniería, Estadística o estudios relacionados.
Experiencia previa en un rol de análisis de datos o BI, de mínimo 1 año, y previa en una posición similar de un mínimo de 3 años.
Conocimiento de herramientas de BI (particularmente Tableau), bases de datos y herramientas de integración y transformación de datos (ETL).
Se valorará experiencia y conocimiento del entorno JD Edwards. y de los principios y mejores prácticas de calidad de datos.
Autonomía, iniciativa y proactividad para liderar proyectos y proponer mejoras de manera constante.
Capacidad de organización y meticulosidad, el cumplimiento de deadlines gestionando múltiples tareas de forma simultánea, así como una alta capacidad analítica.
Un mínimo de un 25% del tiempo el rol se ejercerá directamente en los negocios adquiridos, que pueden ser tanto nacionales como internacionales.


¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo?


Oportunidades para el crecimiento profesional dentro de un equipo internacional.
Plan de compensación flexible que incluye seguro de salud, guardería, transporte y comida, adaptado a tus necesidades. Además, incluye un seguro para tu mascota,
Acceso exclusivo a la plataforma Bakers Vip Club, con descuentos en ocio y consumo solo para nuestros colaboradores.
Subvención en el menú de cantina, para que disfrutes de la comida a un coste reducido.
Desayuno Europastry: ¡Empieza tu día con nuestros mejores productos!
Descuento exclusivo para empleados en nuestros productos de Europastry.
¡Acceso a gimnasio y pistas de pádel del recinto para mantener tu bienestar físico!
Viernes tarde con horario intensivo.
Lockers disponibles en el edificio, donde puedes recibir tus pedidos en cualquier momento.


En Europastry, ofrecemos un espacio de trabajo diverso e inclusivo donde todas las personas se sientan valoradas y respetadas. Estamos comprometidos con prácticas de contratación justas y equitativas, implementamos programas de formación para asegurar que toda nuestra plantilla conozca y esté comprometida con estos principios.

Estamos interesados en el valor único que puedes aportar a nuestro equipo, independientemente de cualquier otro aspecto. Por favor, envía un CV que destaque tus logros profesionales y habilidades. No es necesario incluir fotografías ni datos personales que no sean relevantes para la evaluación de tu candidatura.

¿Te gustaría ser Baker?

Title: Analista de datos (M/H)
Description:
En Empresas IMAN, estamos en búsqueda de un/a Analista de Datos para formar parte del equipo de Servicios Centrales con sede en Terrassa.




Buscamos un profesional con experiencia en la creación de informes interactivos en Power BI y desarrollo de aplicaciones en PowerApps. Será responsable de transformar datos en información útil para la toma de decisiones, además de diseñar soluciones que optimicen procesos mediante herramientas de la Power Platform de Microsoft.




Funciones:

Desarrollo de Informes y Dashboards en Power BI.

Crear y mantener reportes interactivos que visualicen datos de forma clara.
Optimizar modelos de datos y aplicar fórmulas DAX para obtener métricas relevantes.




Desarrollo de Aplicaciones en PowerApps

Diseñar aplicaciones orientadas a la digitalización y automatización de procesos.
Integrar estas aplicaciones con diversas fuentes de datos y establecer flujos de trabajo eficientes mediante Power Automate.

Integración y Gestión de Datos

Consolidar información proveniente de bases de datos, APIs, archivos y otras fuentes.
Diseñar y optimizar procesos ETL para garantizar la integridad y precisión de los datos.
Gestionar y mejorar consultas SQL y almacenes de datos.




Calidad y Seguridad de la Información

Implementar controles para asegurar la calidad y seguridad de los datos.
Aplicar normativas y buenas prácticas en la gestión y protección de la información.




Colaboración con Equipos de Negocio

Trabajar conjuntamente con otros departamentos para identificar necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones de datos.
Presentar de forma clara los insights y recomendaciones a los distintos stakeholders.




Requisitos:

Experiencia comprobada en el desarrollo de informes en Power BI y aplicaciones en PowerApps.
Conocimientos en integración de datos, procesos ETL y optimización de consultas SQL.
Capacidad analítica, orientada a la solución de problemas y al trabajo en equipo.
Habilidad para comunicar hallazgos técnicos a audiencias no especializadas.
Residir en Terrassa o alrededores.
Valorable carné de conducir y disponibilidad de vehículo propio.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contratación indefinida. Posición estable.
Jornada completa de lunes a viernes de 9 a 18. Flexibilidad.
Salario a negociar según experiencia y expectativas.

Title: Analista de Negocio (Data Analyst)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Occident, una de las empresas con mayor relevancia en el sector asegurador español, está emprendiendo, desde su departamento de Analítica de Negocio, la transformación de la organización hacia un modelo data-centric.




En este contexto, el departamento de Analítica de Negocio fomenta el desarrollo y la aplicación de modelos de Inteligencia Artificial para la resolución de problemas y mejora de procesos de negocio en la compañía.

Dentro de este departamento, estamos buscando la incorporación de un estudiante con interés en el área de la Inteligencia Artificial con la finalidad de colaborar con el equipo en un rol de analista de negocio. Este rol consistirá en entender las problemáticas de los equipos de negocio de la compañía para encontrar soluciones tecnológicas, basadas en el uso de datos, que ayuden a la mejora de sus procesos.




Requisitos:

Se busca una persona con pensamiento crítico y habilidades para la resolución de problemas.
Persona proactiva, participativa, con capacidad de trabajo en equipo y ganas de aprender dentro de un área en constante evolución.
Capacidad de abstracción y conceptualización de conceptos difusos.
Conocimientos avanzados de estadística/matemáticas
Conocimientos en jurisprudencia y teorías sociológicas para comprender y analizar el impacto de las políticas y regulaciones en el sector asegurador.
Conocimientos básicos de programación (Python/R/SQL recomendables)
Conocimientos básicos de Machine Learning / Deep Learning




Dedicación:

Reflexión y propuesta de ideas para solucionar problemáticas empresariales con el uso de datos y algoritmos de Machine Learning.
Autonomía para conceptualizar problemas en propuestas de datos concretas de aplicación a negocio.
Análisis y derivación de información útil en base a los sistemas de datos de la compañía.
Aplicación y transformación adecuada de la información para alimentar modelos de Machine Learning.
Evaluación tangible de las soluciones de datos propuestas.
Interrelación con diferentes departamentos de la compañía.




La oferta incluye:

Formación en diversos aspectos de Machine Learning.
Formación en aspectos como "Critical Thinking" o "Problem Solving"
Jornada 25 h/semana.
Horario flexible adaptado a las necesidades del estudiante.
Teletrabajo 3 días semanales.
Retribución bruta de 10€/h.
Posibilidad de realizar el TFG/TFM si la colaboración se prolonga más de un semestre.
Posibilidad de incorporación finalizado el convenio de prácticas.

Show more

Title: Internship in Data Analysis and Dashboard Development
Description:
Role Description As an Intern in the EMEA OPS team within the Service Supply Chain (SSC), you will play a key role in enhancing operational visibility by designing and developing data-driven tools and dashboards, primarily using Power BI. Your focus will be on analyzing data and creating user-friendly dashboards that provide live operational insights, helping the team extract meaningful conclusions to improve our parts shipment and repair operations across EMEA.
Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field, with plans to graduate within the next year.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including Power BI.
Knowledge of database systems and experience with data visualization.
Effective communication skills for presenting insights and working collaboratively.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Nice to Have
Experience with programming languages such as Python or SQL.
Familiarity with supply chain operations or logistics processes.
Knowledge of other data visualization tools or advanced features of Power BI.
Previous internship or project experience involving dashboard development.
Interest in gaining practical experience in a dynamic, operations-focused environment.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 6 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash, basketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as “beer bust” Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour – from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let’s talk!

GBU Entity (ES41)
Show more
HTML:
• Role Description As an Intern in the EMEA OPS team within the Service Supply Chain (SSC), you will play a key role in enhancing operational visibility by designing and developing data-driven tools and dashboards, primarily using Power BI. Your focus will be on analyzing data and creating user-friendly dashboards that provide live operational insights, helping the team extract meaningful conclusions to improve our parts shipment and repair operations across EMEA.
  • Requirements
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field, with plans to graduate within the next year.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including Power BI.
  • Knowledge of database systems and experience with data visualization.
  • Effective communication skills for presenting insights and working collaboratively.
  • Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
  • Nice to Have
  • Experience with programming languages such as Python or SQL.
  • Familiarity with supply chain operations or logistics processes.
  • Knowledge of other data visualization tools or advanced features of Power BI.
  • Previous internship or project experience involving dashboard development.
  • Interest in gaining practical experience in a dynamic, operations-focused environment.

Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.

  • You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
  • Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 6 to12 months agreement.
  • Lunch in the cafeteria.
  • Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash, basketball and yoga.
  • A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as “beer bust” Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
  • We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
  • Free printing Happy hour – from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models.

Sounds like you? Please apply and let’s talk!

GBU Entity (ES41)

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile game studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games consistently rank among the top on iOS and Android, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, our mission is simple: to create amazing gaming experiences and bring fun to everyone!

We’re looking for a Game Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role, you'll analyze player behavior, collaborate with game teams, and help improve our games by driving retention and user conversion.

Using quantitative analysis, data science, statistics, and programming, you’ll generate insights that make a real impact at Socialpoint. To succeed, you’ll need to learn quickly, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work closely with both analytics and game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working model from home and office. What does this mean? You need to live within commuting distance of our Barcelona office to attend important meetings and events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona, if you're not already here.
An impressive 25 days of annual leave, not including public holidays.
An additional 5 days of annual leave during Christmas.
Full Catering for Breakfast and lunch at the office
Private medical insurance for you and your family to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest iOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons in English and Spanish.
Spotify Premium to add a special soundtrack to your adventure.
Legendary social events and parties to let off some steam.
Personal development is key for us: enjoy a significant budget to enhance your skills and knowledge, providing real growth opportunities!


What We Offer You:

Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry – we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Gym Facilities: Want to stay in shape? We have state-of-the-art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
New Office: Enjoy our brand-new office, complete with top-tier amenities, including a professional barista and delicious breakfast options.
Onsite Physiotherapist: Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for any aches and pains.
Onsite Hairdressers: Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on and apply now! Click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Diversity & Conclusion Statement

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic – not an individual’s race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint’s in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: GESTOR/A SENIOR ANALYST PARA MODELOS Y SOLUCIONES DE PROYECCIÓN
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El objetivo de la convocatoria es cubrir una vacante de senior data analyst en el equipo de Modelos y Soluciones de Proyección, en la dirección de Planificación Corporativa.

La ubicación del lugar de trabajo es en los Servicios Centrales (Avenida Diagonal, 621-629, Barcelona)

¿QUÉ PROYECTOS DESARROLLAMOS?

El equipo de planificación corporativa, en colaboración de otras áreas del banco y filiales, realiza las proyecciones de cuenta de resultados, balance, y solvencia para múltiples escenarios y horizontes (por ejemplo: Presupuestación del Grupo Caixabank, Proyecciones del Planificación Estratégica, Estimaciones de impacto de escenarios Adversos, incluyendo usos regulatorios (ICAAP, Stres Test EBA, …)

La misión del equipo de Modelos y Soluciones de Proyección (MSP) es promover la transformación del equipo para agilizar y sistematizar el acercamiento de los datos a las decisiones a través de proyectos de ciencias de datos y nuevas tecnologías. Para ello desarrollamos:

 

Nuevas herramientas/soluciones basadas en el stack tecnológico de Caixabank para ser utilizadas por el equipo de planificación corporativa y otros equipos que participan en la proyección, de manera que se agilicen los procesos y se doten de nuevas capacidades de análisis y reporting sobre la información.
Modelos estadísticos sobre el comportamiento futuro de los drivers que determinan la cuenta de resultados, el balance y la solvencia de la entidad 

 

Funciones:

 

Contribuir a la transformación del equipo desarrollando aplicaciones e impulsando
La adopción de las nuevas tecnologías disponibles en el equipo de MSP
El uso de herramientas de data Discovery por parte del equipo de Planificación Corporativa
Contribuir en el desarrollo de la nueva solución global de proyecciones, que transformará el catálogo actual de aplicaciones no integradas
Realizar evolución continua de las aplicaciones para mejorar continuamente sus capacidades y mantener elevado el apetito por la innovación.
Participar, desde el punto de vista de la contribución de datos y aplicaciones, en los ejercicios de proyección que se realizan.
Requisitos mínimos

 

Grado en carreas científicas (Matemáticas, Informática, ingenierías,..) + Máster de Data (Business Anaytics, Big Data, Data Science,…)
Experiencia de, al menos, 4 años en proyectos Data (ETLs, Data Modeling, Analytics, Visualization, ...)
Alto nivel y experiencia en herramientas de data: SQL, Python, Airflow,...
Se valorará experiencia en las herramientas Google Cloud Platform: Big Query, Composer, Vertex, …
Capacidad de relación, trabajo en equipo e interés por la divulgación del conocimiento que ayude a impulsar las habilidades del equipo. 
Iniciativa propia y alta autonomía en el desarrollo de las tareas asignadas.
¿Qué ofrecemos?

 

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad
Job profile Consulta, estructura y analiza grandes volúmenes de datos haciendo uso de capacidades estadísticas y de programación con el objetivo de encontrar patrones y extraer insights de valor para la entidad. Es capaz de comunicar los insights de una manera clara y estructurada a través de presentaciones y/o cuadros de mando. Competencias H MODELADO DE DATOS, PROCESOS, EVENTOS, OBJETOS H PROTECCIÓN DE DATOS Y NORMATIVA H METODOLOGÍAS PARA LA COLABORACIÓN EN EL DESARROLLO DE CÓDIGO Y CONTROL DE VERSIONES H LENGUAJES DE PROGRAMACIÓN H DEFINICIÓN DE MÉTRICAS DE SEGUIMIENTO DEL NEGOCIO & KPIS H BUSINESS CASE H DATA STORYTELLING H DATA VISUALIZATION H DATA MOVEMENT TOOLS AND ETL H ESTADÍSTICA Y MODELOS DESCRIPTIVOS H BBDD RELACIONALES S.1.1 ALIANZAS – COLABORACIÓN Y TRANSVERSALIDAD S.1.4 ALIANZAS – COMUNICACIÓN S.1.3 ALIANZAS – INFLUENCIA S.1.2 ALIANZAS – ORIENTACIÓN A CLIENTE S.2.1 HUMANISMO – COMUNICACIÓN Y EMPATÍA S.2.2 HUMANISMO – LIDERAZGO Y DESARROLLO DE EQUIPOS / AUTOLIDERAZGO S.4.1 ANTICIPACIÓN – ANTICIPACIÓN Y GESTIÓN DEL CAMBIO S.3.1 EMPODERAMIENTO – FOCO EN RESULTADOS S.5.1 DIVERSIDAD – IMPULSO DE LA DIVERSIDAD H PLANIFICACIÓN Y PROYECCIONES FINANCIERAS H BBDD NO RELACIONALES H ELABORACIÓN DE PRESENTACIONES EJECUTIVAS H ANÁLISIS E INDICADORES FINANCIEROS

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

• Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

•Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

•Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

•Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

•Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

• SQL advanced

• Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

• Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

• Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

• AWS

• Microsoft Azure cloud computing

• Familiarity with DataOps principles

• Familiar with Agile methodologies

• Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

• You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

• You have good presentation skills.

• You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

• You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

• You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

• You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Si ets professional del màrqueting digital i l’anàlisi de dades i t’interessa treballar en el món de l’educació en el lleure, el Tercer Sector i la sostenibilitat, tenim la feina perfecta per a tu!

Busquem una persona amb experiència, capacitat per adaptar-se, resolutiva, autònoma, proactiva i amb ganes de treballar en equip, que tingui visió transversal i capacitat d’analitzar campanyes digitals i processos transaccionals.




Formaràs part de l’equip de comunicació de Fundesplai i la teva missió principal serà establir mètriques de seguiment per les campanyes de comunicació, fer el seguiment i anàlisi de les campanyes, interpretar els resultats, i proposar millores.




Requisits:

• Mínim dos anys d'experiència 

• Estudis en analítica web, màrqueting digital, SEO i SEM

• Alt nivell i experiència amb eines analítiques web: Google Analytics / Matomo (conficuració avançada, esdeveniments, dashboards)

• Mètriques, anàlisi i coneixement profund de campanyes digitals: e-mail màrqueting, Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads,...

• Experiència i coneixement de Semrush, Matomo i Metricool

• Capacitat analítica, síntesi, redacció i presentació d'informes.

• Capacitat d'interpretació de les dades, visualització i contextualització

• Capacitat organitzativa, d'autogestió i treball en equip.




Es valorarà positivament

• Coneixement del sector de l'educació en el lleure i el Tercer Sector

• Experiència en eines de visualització de dades com Power Bi, Tableau o Google Date Studio

• Coneixement bàsic de llenguatge de programació o scripts (SQL, Python, JavaScript)

• Coneixement de WordPress, especialment l'extensió DIVI

• Bon nivell de català i castellà. Valorable anglès.

• Valorable carnet B1.




Oferim:

Per què t’agradarà treballar a Fundesplai?

Perquè...

• Formaràs part d’un equip dinàmic, compromès i amb molt bon ambient de treball.

• Tindràs flexibilitat horària, treballant per objectius i amb possibilitat de teletreball algun dia a la setmana.

• Treballar en una entitat sense afany de lucre aporta valor al teu dia a dia.

• Sabràs que la teva feina estarà contribuint a un món millor, més just, més sostenible, més igualitari, més inclusiu.... la missió de Fundesplai és «educar els infants i joves, enfortir les entitats de lleure i el Tercer Sector, millorar el medi ambient i promoure la ciutadania i la inclusió social, amb voluntat transformadora».




Què t’oferim?

• T’oferim un contracte de 37,5h setmanals amb un sou brut anual de 31000€.

• Incorporació immediata!

Show more
HTML:
Si ets professional del màrqueting digital i l’anàlisi de dades i t’interessa treballar en el món de l’educació en el lleure, el Tercer Sector i la sostenibilitat, tenim la feina perfecta per a tu!

Busquem una persona amb experiència, capacitat per adaptar-se, resolutiva, autònoma, proactiva i amb ganes de treballar en equip, que tingui visió transversal i capacitat d’analitzar campanyes digitals i processos transaccionals.


Formaràs part de l’equip de comunicació de Fundesplai i la teva missió principal serà establir mètriques de seguiment per les campanyes de comunicació, fer el seguiment i anàlisi de les campanyes, interpretar els resultats, i proposar millores.


Requisits:

• Mínim dos anys d'experiència 

• Estudis en analítica web, màrqueting digital, SEO i SEM

• Alt nivell i experiència amb eines analítiques web: Google Analytics / Matomo (conficuració avançada, esdeveniments, dashboards)

• Mètriques, anàlisi i coneixement profund de campanyes digitals: e-mail màrqueting, Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads,...

• Experiència i coneixement de Semrush, Matomo i Metricool

• Capacitat analítica, síntesi, redacció i presentació d'informes.

• Capacitat d'interpretació de les dades, visualització i contextualització

• Capacitat organitzativa, d'autogestió i treball en equip.


Es valorarà positivament

• Coneixement del sector de l'educació en el lleure i el Tercer Sector

• Experiència en eines de visualització de dades com Power Bi, Tableau o Google Date Studio

• Coneixement bàsic de llenguatge de programació o scripts (SQL, Python, JavaScript)

• Coneixement de WordPress, especialment l'extensió DIVI

• Bon nivell de català i castellà. Valorable anglès.

• Valorable carnet B1.

Title: Analytics Consultant - Customer & Marketing
Description:
¿Te imaginas participando en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?

En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.

Desde el equipo de Customer & Marketing se requiere incorporar a un Analytics Consultant con sólidas habilidades en análisis de datos, estadística, y herramientas de visualización, para acompañar a nuestros clientes en sus retos más complejos. Se busca un perfil que dentro del ámbito del marketing sea capaz de proporcionar insights de alto valor y recomendaciones estratégicas a nuestros clientes con el objetivo de mejorar la toma de decisiones.

Buscamos a una persona con interés por el mundo de la consultoría, apasionada por el marketing, que le guste trabajar en equipo, y acostumbrado/a a trabajar en entornos multinacionales.

Tareas:


Análisis post mortem de campañas de marketing y generación de insights de negocio
Extracción y armonización de datos para la generación de segmentos y audiencias
Análisis de campañas de marketing multicanal y evaluación de la inversión publicitaria
Creación de reportes destinados a las áreas de negocio y marketing para mostrar resultados de manera clara e intuitiva
Entender los requerimientos y necesidades de las partes de negocio involucradas proporcionando soluciones técnicas de valor.
Identificar oportunidades de mejora y optimización en base a los análisis realizados
Participar en la implementación y seguimiento de estrategias de marketing basadas en el dato
Presentar los resultados y las estrategias definidas al equipo gerencial y directivo
Entender el entorno tecnológico de los clientes y mantenerse al día sobre las últimas tendencias y herramientas de análisis de datos
Trabajar con equipos multidisciplinares (negocio, analítica, diseño, tecnología…)


Requisitos:


Conocimientos sólidos en herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos. Esto incluye experiencia avanzada en el uso de herramientas de SQL, Python y/o R.
Conocimientos de herramientas de Business Intelligence como Power BI, Tableau o Qlik. Se valorará tener nociones de Adobe Analytics y/o Google Analytics.
Capacidad para interpretar los resultados del análisis de datos y traducirlos en información accionable para los diferentes equipos y partes interesadas
Experiencia en la identificación de métricas clave de rendimiento (KPI)
Capacidad para identificar y resolver problemas técnicos, detectar anomalías o errores en los datos y proponer mejoras en los procesos analíticos existentes
Habilidades de comunicación para interactuar con stakehoders de todos los niveles, defender conclusiones y propuestas tecnológicas y trabajar en equipo con perfiles de diferentes áreas
Deseable experiencia en Consultoría, y/o grandes empresas
Nivel fluido de castellano e inglés alto


¿Cómo es trabajar en Deloitte?

🤩 Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendrás un largo recorrido y aprendizaje

☯️ Un día a día híbrido-flexible: tendrás horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes

⚽ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades culturales y deportivas… ¡y mucho más!

🧘‍♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!

🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan

🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?

🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:


Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor


¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Apply now »

We provide inspiration worldwide with our intelligent solutions for industrial automation. We offer a high degree of flexibility to our more than 20.000 employees. We provide you excellent prospects for turning your ideas into reality – because innovation requires freedom and security. We need you. Apply now and keep the world moving.

Senior Data Analyst

About FESTO: FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales processes and strategies.

Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities


Lead the collection, cleaning, and analysis of large and complex data sets to support business operations (sales, web analytics, marketing…).
Develop and maintain advanced reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive business insights.
Develop and present comprehensive data-driven insights and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
Mentor and guide junior data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
Review and oversee tasks performed by junior analysts, ensuring accuracy and quality of work.
Conceptualize, follow up, and deliver analytics projects, including definition of KPIs, creation and communication of insights, and project definitions for junior analysts.


Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales or business analytics role.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and technical leadership
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale cloud data analysis frameworks
Proficiency in Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to extract and translate business metrics and questions from data sets into well-documented and actionable insights.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data-driven insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.


By submitting your CV or application, you consent to Festo Automation collecting, using, and storing your personal data for the purpose of processing your application and considering you for future employment opportunities. Your information will be used exclusively by Festo Automation and handled in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

Festo Automation is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of social or cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, or religious beliefs.

Company: Festo Automation S.A.U.

Location:

Barcelona, ES, 08908

We look forward to your application!

Apply now »

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Competitive Intelligence
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Senior Analyst in our AXSI team, you'll lead competitive intelligence initiatives and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spearhead the development and execution of sophisticated analytical frameworks that shape & strengthen our market position.


Lead Competitive Analysis: Dive deep into market trends, analysing strategies employed by industry players to acquire budgets and launch campaigns with our clients.
Client Consultations: Conduct in-depth discussions with clients to understand their testing processes and decision-making factors when evaluating different advertising solutions.
Performance Testing: Design and implement sophisticated testing strategies to showcase Criteo's superior performance and value proposition.
Strategy Development: Contribute to our pool of competitive strategies and help shape the roadmap for our competitive intelligence tools.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success.



Who You Are:


4+ years of experience in data analytics, with expertise in competitive intelligence and market analysis
Demonstrated experience leading and delivering strategic projects that directly impact business outcomes
Advanced proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools, with a track record of building scalable analytical solutions
Strong leadership skills with experience mentoring junior analysts and managing complex stakeholder relationships
Strategic mindset with proven ability to translate complex market insights into actionable business strategies
Experience presenting to and influencing senior stakeholders
Track record of developing and implementing innovative analytical methodologies
Advanced problem-solving skills with experience tackling ambiguous business challenges
Fluent in English with exceptional communication skills and ability to influence at all levels
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



Diverse experiences enrich our team. Even if you don't tick every box, we want to hear from you!

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
