HTML:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

  • Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
  • Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
  • Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
  • High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
  • Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
  • Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
  • Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
  • Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
  • Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
  • Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
  • Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
  • Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards


Requirements

  • Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
  • Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
  • Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
  • Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
  • In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
  • Experience working with data visualization tools
  • Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
  • Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
  • Proactive attitude and results-oriented


Benefits

Perks of being one of us

  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
  • Remote work
  • Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
  • Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
  • Enhanced career path designed just for you
  • External training budget
  • We celebrate all company landmarks

Title: Business Intelligence Power BI
Description:
En Logista, tendrás la oportunidad de llegar tan lejos como te propongas. Aprenderás a diario y aportarás valor en un entorno profesional, sólido, diverso, sostenible y tecnológico colaborando con equipos de alto rendimiento. Si buscas dar un salto profesional, vivir nuevas experiencias y estar en constante crecimiento, este es tu lugar. A nosotros nos motiva que consigas éxitos y sobre todo disfrutes del camino ¿y tú? ¿te animas a sumarte a este viaje?




En concreto, Logista Pharma es el único distribuidor farmacéutico independiente que abastece a hospitales y farmacias (España y Portugal) con la más amplia gama de servicios para la industria farmacéutica. Esto nos permite ofrecer el mejor servicio a los sectores en los que estamos altamente especializados, como son, transporte de productos farmacéuticos, transporte de productos de alimentación & retail y productos de alto valor que requieren estrictos protocolos de seguridad.




Precisamos incorporar un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS -Business Intelligence Power BI en nuestras oficinas de Leganés (Madrid)




Responsabilidades:

Exploración de datos, validación de hipótesis, identificación de sesgos, correlaciones y realización de diagnósticos sobre la calidad del dato.
Creación de dashboard e informes en PowerBI para la presentación de resultados a negocio.
Identificar nuevos requisitos de visualización y KPI dentro de los paneles de PowerBI con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades comerciales.
Identificar KPI críticos y evaluar demandas.
Participación en las fases de entendimiento del negocio, trabajando conjuntamente con los Business Owners del proyecto.
Mantenimiento y resolución de incidencias de los Dashboards.




Requisitos:

Grado universitario en Ingenierías, Informática + ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística y Empresa, Física o similares. Se valorará máster o posgrado en Analytics o Big Data.
Background y conocimiento de la herramienta Power BI, incluyendo la capacidad de crear modelos de datos, diseñar informes y paneles, utilizar DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) para crear medidas y cálculos personalizados
Perfil analítico
Inglés: Mínimo C1
Show more

Title: Analista de Datos/Contable con gran Dominio de Excel UCJC
Description:
La Universidad Camilo José Cela busca incorporar a un/a Analista de Datos/Contable con gran Dominio de Excel.

Funciones:

Análisis de datos y elaboración de informes detallados Gestión y depuración de bases de datos.
Creación de modelos y gráficos en Excel para representar datos de manera clara y visual.
Automatización de procesos y optimización de informes utilizando Excel.
Contabilidad de pequeñas empresas del grupo.

Título universitario en áreas afines (contabilidad, matemáticas, economía u otros).
Experiencia mínima de 3 años en un puesto similar.
Inglés nivel medio.
Dominio de herramientas contables (Business Central) y Microsoft office (especialmente Excel nivel experto: funciones, tablas dinámicas, power Query y Power Pivot…)




Lugar habitual de trabajo: UCJC Villafranca

Tipo de contrato: Indefinido

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
NTT DATA somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 190.000 profesionales, tan diverso como diversos son los más de 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad.




¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.




Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.




¿Te gustaría formar parte de este equipo? Buscamos profesionales de análisis de datos para un gran cliente multinacional español del sector textil, que tengan motivación por crecer y desarrollar una carrera profesional dentro del cliente, trabajando en proyectos de gran envergadura, acompañados de un plan de formación y con mucha flexibilidad.




Requisitos

Buen nivel python y SQL
Integración de datos
Snowflake Ecosystem
Generación de informes en PowerBI y Report Builder
Experiencia trabajando en entornos Cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP)




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Salario competitivo acorde a tu perfil, ámbito de especialización tecnológica y aportación de valor en conocimiento y experiencia.
Proceso de revisiones salariales acorde a la evolución dentro de la cuenta de cliente.
Contrato indefinido a jornada completa y estabilidad laboral.
Beneficios sociales y retribución flexible (opción de seguro médico para ti y tus familiares).
Plan de formación y certificaciones que te permitan desarrollar conocimientos y capacidades dentro de la cuenta del cliente.
Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo, presencialidad en oficina de cliente 2 días a la semana.




Apúntate y ven a formar parte de una de las mayores compañías de IT del mundo. ¡Te estamos esperando!

Title: Global Media Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

The Global Measure team is looking for a candidate for the position of Global Media Data Analyst. His/her knowledge of online media combined with his/her analytical skills will shape the core of his/her responsibilities.




The Global Media Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring the technical feasibility of product enhancements and new developments for Reporting and Measurement projects and tools, as well as being a tech liaison between the Product Owner and IT teams. Reporting directly to the Product Owner, this role will bridge the gap between strategic product vision and technical implementation, collaborating with IT teams while providing in-depth technical guidance within the Product team.




S/He will work with the Global Product Owner, and Global IT in the business and technical definition of Reporting and Measurement tools and projects.
S/He will support the Product team to align business requirements with functional and technical specification and architecture.
S/He provides data expertise and works closely with the Product Owner, and other HAVAS technical teams.
S/He contributes to the continuous improvement of working practices, application quality, tooling and agile processes.




Mission & Responsibilities

Functional:

Technical Feasibility Analysis:

Assess and validate technical viability of Reporting and Measurement tools and projects.
Identify risks and suggest efficiency improvements and scalability for Reporting and Measurement tools and projects, and their technical frameworks.
Provide technical recommendations for enhancements and new developments within the existing tech stack, as well as potential integrations with other tools to optimize performance
Liaise between Product team and IT for seamless handoffs, and support IT implementation.




Media Expertise in Measurement and Reporting:

Leverage an in-depth understanding of media and campaign reporting processes to translate a business brief into a tech brief and guide data integration, visualization, and reporting requirements for market and client implementation.
Understand and collaborate on definition of KPI frameworks, naming conventions, data mapping, and schema design.




Data Governance and Best Practices:

Work with the Product Owner in defining and developing best practices for data governance, including mapping and transformation.




Technical & Data Expertise:

Experience:

4 to 6 years in a technical role within media, marketing, or campaign reporting domains, demonstrating a strong understanding of omnichannel planning and measurement frameworks.
Demonstrated experience in defining projects using reporting tools such as Power BI and Tableau, as well as working with cloud-based platforms like Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Microsoft Azure.
Experience with Data Extraction and Aggregation Tools: Proven familiarity and hands-on experience with platforms like Funnel, Supermetrics, Datorama, or similar tools for extracting, aggregating, and integrating data from multiple sources to support reporting and analytics.




Familiarity with key Digital Marketing data sources such as:

Google Marketing Platform (Google Ads, CM360, DV360, SA360).
Social Platforms (Facebook Ads, Business Manager, Sprinklr, Paragone, TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat).
Other DSPs (Xandr, Adobe Advertising Cloud, Teads, The Trade Desk, Sizmek).
Verification Tools (DoubleVerify, IAS).




Technical Skills:

Expertise in Power BI, Excel, Power Query, SQL, GCP (BigQuery).
Strong understanding of data mapping, ETL processes, and naming conventions.




Soft Skills & Competencies

Excellent English – written and spoken.
Problem-solving mindset focused on scalable solutions.
Good interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.
Proactive and ability to initiate.
Good analytical problem-solving skills.
Positive, persistent, and can-do attitude.
Show more

  • Experience with Data Extraction and Aggregation Tools: Proven familiarity and hands-on experience with platforms like Funnel, Supermetrics, Datorama, or similar tools for extracting, aggregating, and integrating data from multiple sources to support reporting and analytics.


Familiarity with key Digital Marketing data sources such as:

  • Google Marketing Platform (Google Ads, CM360, DV360, SA360).
  • Social Platforms (Facebook Ads, Business Manager, Sprinklr, Paragone, TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat).
  • Other DSPs (Xandr, Adobe Advertising Cloud, Teads, The Trade Desk, Sizmek).
  • Verification Tools (DoubleVerify, IAS).


Technical Skills:

  • Expertise in Power BI, Excel, Power Query, SQL, GCP (BigQuery).
  • Strong understanding of data mapping, ETL processes, and naming conventions.


Soft Skills & Competencies

  • Excellent English – written and spoken.
  • Problem-solving mindset focused on scalable solutions.
  • Good interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.
  • Proactive and ability to initiate.
  • Good analytical problem-solving skills.
  • Positive, persistent, and can-do attitude.

Title: Tecnico Junior Business Intelligence
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Sobre nosotros 👥




En Volkswagen Group Retail S.L.U. nos dedicamos a gestionar la Red de Concesionarios Oficiales de las marcas Porsche, Volkswagen, Audi, Seat, Cupra, Skoda y Volkswagen Vehículos Comerciales más importantes de España. Somos parte de Porsche Holding, el mayor distribuidor de automóviles de Europa, con más de 33,000 empleados y con presencia en más de 30 países, entre esos España.




En VGRS creemos en lo que hacemos, creemos que los más de 1.600 empleados que formamos parte del Grupo somos los que damos forma al éxito de nuestra organización, y por ello, nos superamos día a día y aspiramos a ser los pioneros en el futuro de la movilidad. Apostamos por la promoción interna, es por eso que tenemos como objetivo que el 90% de nuestras vacantes se cubran a través de nuestro talento interno. Nos atrevemos a cosas nuevas, somos valientes e innovadores, vivimos la diversidad en todas sus facetas, cumplimos con nuestra palabra, estamos orgullosos de nuestros resultados y trabajamos bajo la premisa “nosotros en vez de yo”.




Nos encontramos en plena búsqueda de Técnico BI Junior enfocado a negocio. 👀




El objetivo de la posición trata de la gestión y análisis de datos y generación de informes, y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos y estrategias, dando soporte a los miembros del equipo. 😉




¿Cómo será tu día a día? 📝




Desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos.
Extraer, transformar y cargar datos de diversas fuentes para su análisis.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para identificar necesidades de información y proporcionar soluciones analíticas adecuadas.
Garantizar la calidad y precisión de los datos presentados en los informes.
Mantenerse actualizado sobre las mejores prácticas y tendencias en Business Intelligence y análisis de datos.




Tu perfil encaja con la posición si... 🧐




Grado en Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística o similares.
Mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en roles de Business Intelligence.
Sólidos conocimientos en SQL y experiencia en procesos ETL.
Experiencia con herramientas de BI como Qlik, Power BI o Tableau es valorada.
Habilidades analíticas y atención al detalle.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
Nivel intermedio de inglés.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Salario fijo 📑
Seguro de vida a cargo de la empresa📌
Descuentos especiales de empleados VGRS🌟
VGRSalud (actividades deportivas)🎾 🧘‍♀️
Ubicación: en nuestras oficinas centrales en El Prat de Llobregat (Mas Blau) 📍
Horario 09:00 a 18.30h (L a J) de 9 a 14h (V)
Subvención comida 🍲




Si te sientes identificado con lo descrito anteriormente, eres la persona que estamos buscando.




🔑Nosotros te entregamos la llave de tu nueva carrera y tú sólo ... ¡acelera! 🚗

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
excelia es una firma multinacional de Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales con más de 25 años de experiencia. Prestamos servicio en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos desde nuestras 10 oficinas propias.




¡Estamos en busca de un/a Data Analyst Financiero. Si te apasiona el análisis de datos y deseas formar parte de una empresa líder ¡esta es tu oportunidad! 🏦💼




📍 Ubicación: Madrid 🌆







🕵🏽‍♀️ ¿Qué experiencia necesitamos?




1-2 años de experiencia en el campo.
SQL
Pyspark
Databricks
Excel
Herramientas de visualización (Power Bi, Microstrategy)







➕Funciones




Extraer, limpiar y transformar datos financieros utilizando SQL, PySpark y Databricks.
Diseñar y optimizar consultas para el manejo de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Desarrollar dashboards y reportes interactivos en Power BI o MicroStrategy.
Analizar KPIs financieros, ingresos, costos, rentabilidad y riesgos.
Automatizar reportes y procesos en Excel y herramientas BI.
Presentar insights y recomendaciones a stakeholders no técnicos.
Colaborar con equipos de tecnología y negocio para mejorar modelos de datos.
Implementar soluciones de optimización y automatización de análisis de datos.
Garantizar la calidad y consistencia de los datos utilizados en los análisis.







¿Qué ofrecemos?😉🚀




📝 Contratación estable, para que puedas seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.

💰 Tu banda salarial será acorde a tu experiencia y tu trayectoria profesional. Además podrás beneficiarte a través de nuestro paquete de retribución flexible.

📖 Creemos en tu desarrollo profesional, por ello te ofrecemos formación continua. Queremos ayudarte a mejorar tus habilidades técnicas.

🏡 Ofrecemos un modelo de trabajo remoto para adaptarnos mejor a tus necesidades.







¿Te interesa la oportunidad? ¿Crees que encajas con el perfil que buscamos? ¡Haz clic en "inscribirme" y forma parte de excelia, una compañía internacional donde desarrollar todo tu talento!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Si las palabras "Calidad del dato" despiertan en ti entusiasmo y emoción, deberías continuar leyendo esta gran oportunidad.

En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes más de 3 años de experiencia como Consultor/a del Dato, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

- Modalidad 100% remoto.

- Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.

- Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.

- Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.

- Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.

- Retribución competitiva.




¿Qué buscamos?




A nivel formación:

- Máster, Licenciado o Ingeniero Superior en Informática o relacionado con las Tecnologías de la Información

- Formación específica en Transformación Digital y estrategias TIC gubernamentales




Experiencia:

- Perfil con 3 años en Calidad del Dato y cuadros de mando.

- Experiencia con el Esquema Nacional de Interoperabilidad (ENI)

- Administración Digital: normativa, servicios de administración digital de la AGE, gobierno abierto, etc.




- Herramientas específicas: Suite Atlassian, QLIK, etc.




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.

Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que tenemos una facturación mundial de más de 3.650 millones de euros, contamos con 52.700 profesionales y estamos presentes en más de 30 países.

Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RightHand, compañía especializada en atracción del talento digital y contratación, estamos colaborando en la búsqueda de un Data Analyst con nuestro cliente, consultoría internacional que diseña soluciones de negocio y crecimiento a través de la data, tecnología y creatividad desde 2012. Actualmente, están en pleno crecimiento y por ello, a día de hoy abarcan cinco países: Italia, (Milán, Torino y Roma), España-Madrid, Serbia-Belgrado, USA-NewYork y México-Ciudad de México. Estamos buscando incorporar en el equipo a una persona que quiera seguir creciendo y desarrollándose profesionalmente con ellos dentro del área de Data.




Funciones y Responsabilidades:

Definir análisis de datos para proporcionar insights que añadan valor a nuestros clientes.
Estudiar el "customer journey" online del usuario para optimizar sus flujos y procesos.
Diseñar soluciones de medición digital personalizadas según las necesidades del cliente, estableciendo KPIs, Dashboards y guías de etiquetado.
Brindar soporte y recomendaciones en la configuración de herramientas de medición y tagging.
Demostrar una sólida capacidad para interpretar datos, analizar problemas y presentar soluciones.
Poseer un conocimiento avanzado en Google Marketing Platform: Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager y Looker Studio.
Elaborar planes de medición: definición de DataLayer, creación de guía de etiquetado y validación junto a los equipos de IT.
Mantener una comunicación efectiva con los equipos de IT y Medios.
Gestionar las tareas y al equipo a cargo para la ejecución de los proyectos.
Crear dashboards en herramientas de visualización de datos.
Elaborar informes personalizados en herramientas de medición.
Tener un dominio avanzado en la elaboración de hojas de cálculo.




Si cumples con los requisitos y estás listo para un nuevo desafío en tu carrera, ¡esperamos recibir tu aplicación!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are:

At Emburse, you’ll not just imagine the future – you’ll build it. As a leader in travel and expense solutions, we are creating a future where technology drives business value and inspires extraordinary results.

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Emburse Marketing team. This person will help the team to enhance their campaigns by using data to create actionable i nsights.

Using Salesforce CRM to track both online and offline campaigns, this role will create self-service tools and provide enablement to ensure the whole team knows and understands the data. A deep understanding of the digital marketing landscape and the full marketing funnel is essential to excel in this position.

An ideal candidate will possess exceptional stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data in a clear and easy-to-understand manner and is fluent not only in Salesforce CRM, but also ideally has skills with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Lookr.

What You Will Do


Conduct data analysis and provide insights to enable Marketers to optimize their campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and translate them into data analysis solutions (from ad-hoc reports and self-service dashboards).
Use Tableau or Looker studio to design and build easy-to-use dashboards, often connecting multiple data sources.
Present complex data to a broad audience, with varying levels of data literacy, in a manner that is clear and actionable.
Develop and automate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate findings and trends.
Provide education and training to Marketers so they can self-service and understand our various marketing metrics.
Partner with the web experience team to design and measure digital experiments (AB tests) based on user behaviors and UX research.
Collaborate with stakeholders to create targets and provide forecasts for key performance indicators (KPIs).
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and provide actionable insights to support business initiatives and solve complex problems.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to analyze complex datasets.


What We Are Looking For


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and with Executives.
Proficiency with the Salesforce CRM suite for data analysis and visualizations such as Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud
Hand-on experience with data manipulation in Excel/Google Sheets and visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker Studio.
Commercial acumen, ideally around SaaS B2B Sales and Marketing data.
Data cleaning and preparation using tools such as Coefficient or Tableau Prep.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills


Why Emburse?

Finance is changing—and at Emburse, we’re leading the way. Our AI-powered solutions help organizations eliminate inefficiencies, gain real-time visibility, and optimize spend—so they can focus on what’s next, not what’s slowing them down.


A Company with Momentum – We serve 12M+ users across 120 countries, helping businesses modernize


their finance operations.


A Team That Innovates – Work alongside some of the brightest minds in finance, tech, and AI to solve real-


world challenges.


A Culture That Empowers – Competitive pay, flexible work, and an inclusive, collaborative environment that


supports your success.


A Career That Matters – Your work here drives efficiency, innovation, and smarter financial decision-making


for businesses everywhere.

Shape your future & find what’s next at Emburse.

Emburse provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Emburse complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location where the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy and WFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).
Show more

Title: Analista Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

¿Por qué te estamos buscando?

Liderar la creación, mantenimiento y evolución de las herramientas comerciales en el canal de hostelería, poniendo la experiencia de usuario en el centro para que el Route-to-Market de MSM pueda aportar un valor extra diferenciador y capturar el máximo potencial de cada cliente. Mejorando así nuestra toma de decisiones basada en datos y optimizando nuestras estrategias comerciales en hostelería.

Tu día a día en Mahou San Miguel


Coordinar el desarrollo y ecosistema de las mejores herramientas comerciales para hostelería, asegurando su correcta implementación y uso.
Priorizar y coordinar el mantenimiento y los evolutivos de SHERPA (Salesforce) y otras herramientas, asegurando las funcionalidades clave para el negocio.
Coordinar con sistemas, proveedores y otros departamentos clave el avance de las diferentes tareas evolutivas, su testeo, comunicación a usuarios y formación.
Fomentar y consolidar el uso de las herramientas comerciales (BOARD; CRM Analytics; Tableau, SALESFORCE ), asegurando la accesibilidad y disponibilidad de las mismas para todos los departamentos.
Diseñar planes y programas de formación, coordinando la formación al equipo comercial hostelería en las nuevas herramientas definidas, así como los acompañamientos con los gestores para ayudar en la comprensión y utilización de las políticas.


Entre otras..

¿Qué requisitos debes cumplir?


Grado, Licenciatura, Diplomatura o FPII
Nivel de inglés fluido.
Perfil de analista con experiencia en gestión de proyectos de tecnología, dato y analítica, sistemas y/o CRM.
Debe entender y ser capaz de trasladar problemas de negocio a entornos de desarrollo de sistemas y viceversa, ser capaz de declinar necesidades y requisitos de sistema a agentes comerciales de campo, siempre con altos niveles de desempeño e influencia.


La diversidad, clave en nuestra estrategia

Nuestro compromiso con la diversidad, la inclusión y la igualdad de oportunidades está presente desde nuestro nacimiento en 1890. Nuestra visión, en este sentido, es “construir el futuro a través de la suma de personas únicas, impulsando la diversidad de forma activa como fuente de riqueza en la sociedad”.

Por eso, esta oferta está dirigida a cualquier persona que reúna los requisitos exigidos para el puesto, independientemente de sus características.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡En SII Group Spain estamos buscando un/a Consultor/a IT para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo!💥




¿Tienes ganas de aprender y crecer profesionalmente?¿Cuentas con una experiencia de entre 3 a 5 años como consultor en áreas de logistica y mejora continua?¿Quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁







¿Qué te ofrecemos en SII Group Spain? 🚀

Contrato indefinido 📝
Formación personalizada que te permitirá crecer📚: Podrás disponer de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars así como a Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching…
🏡Teletrabajo: Modelo de trabajo 3/2 híbrido.
Paquete retributivo flexible: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).
Ambiente internacional.
Somos una familia 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦: Sabemos que las personas son nuestro principal valor añadido y por eso queremos estar cerca de todos los compañeros realizando After-Works, cenas y eventos de empresa🥂




¿Qué buscamos en ti? 💻🚀

Dominio de herramientas informáticas: Office, Internet, SAP, Power BI, Excel avanzado, y otras herramientas de BI o gestión de proyectos.
Formación Profesional de Grado Superior en comercio internacional y/o logística.
Experiencia de 3 a 5 años en un departamento logístico o en áreas de Mejora Continua.
Idiomas necesarios: español e inglés.
Conocimiento sobre actividad logística y de la cadena de suministros.




¿Qué tareas realizarías en tu día a día? 💻🚀

Creación y mantenimiento de informes que den el pulso de la actividad y que faciliten el análisis y la toma de decisiones.
Seguimiento de acciones y/o mejoras.
Definir acciones que contribuyan a mejorar los resultados o alcanzar los objetivos definidos en la estrategia corporativa.
Participar en la definición de indicadores y crear los sistemas necesarios para poder medir el alcance de estos y sus desviaciones o adecuación con el objetivo.
Analizar los resultados y elaborar planes de acción junto con las personas responsables de cada proceso.
Asegurar y facilitar la puesta en marcha del plan de acción.
Controlar que las acciones llevadas a cabo han tenido los resultados esperados.




¿Qué encontrarás en SII?

En SII Group Spain encontrarás en un equipo joven, profesional y amantes del trabajo en equipo, con buen rollo y constante aprendizaje colaborativo. Siempre ¡Todos a una!💙




Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países y más de 16.000 profesionales. Es por ello, que podrías disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura.




Nuestro propósito es crear proyectos innovadores que faciliten la vida a nuestros clientes, contratando a los/las mejores profesionales y haciendo que se sientan realizados con su trabajo.




¡Eres el talento que buscamos!

💙¡We are One Team! Certificados por Great Place to Work.💙

Title: Científico de datos
Description:
📊Convierte datos en modelos reales, optimízalos y llévalos a producción con las mejores prácticas.📊




En Tinámica, buscamos un Data Scientist Senior con experiencia en Machine Learning sobre datos tabulares y despliegue en Azure, para desarrollar soluciones en el sector asegurador.




LO QUE HARÁS

Desarrollar modelos de ML con scikit-learn, shap values, xgboost, etc.
Explorar y transformar datos con Python (pandas) y SQL.
Aplicar técnicas de análisis exploratorio y estadístico para el descubrimiento de patrones en datos.
Diseñar y optimizar pipelines para llevar modelos a producción en Azure.
Implementar APIs y servicios en cloud para integrar modelos en entornos reales.
Revisar código, realizar testing y asegurar buenas prácticas de desarrollo (Git).
Presentar resultados y colaborar con equipos técnicos y de negocio.




LO QUE BUSCAMOS EN TI

Experiencia en Machine Learning con datos tabulares.
Dominio de Python (scikit-learn, pandas, SQL, FastAPI).
Conocimiento en Cloud (Azure deseable) y despliegue de modelos.
Buenas prácticas de desarrollo, versionado y testing.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo e interactuar con negocio.




Valoramos además:

Experiencia con TensorFlow/PyTorch.
Conocimientos en MLOps (MLflow, Kubeflow, SageMaker, Vertex AI).
Certificación en Azure Data Scientist Associate (DP-100) o similar.
Conocimiento en Computer Vision, NLP o proyectos de IA Generativa.

Title: Business Intelligence Power BI
Description:
En Logista, tendrás la oportunidad de llegar tan lejos como te propongas. Aprenderás a diario y aportarás valor en un entorno profesional, sólido, diverso, sostenible y tecnológico colaborando con equipos de alto rendimiento. Si buscas dar un salto profesional, vivir nuevas experiencias y estar en constante crecimiento, este es tu lugar. A nosotros nos motiva que consigas éxitos y sobre todo disfrutes del camino ¿y tú? ¿te animas a sumarte a este viaje?




En concreto, Logista Pharma es el único distribuidor farmacéutico independiente que abastece a hospitales y farmacias (España y Portugal) con la más amplia gama de servicios para la industria farmacéutica. Esto nos permite ofrecer el mejor servicio a los sectores en los que estamos altamente especializados, como son, transporte de productos farmacéuticos, transporte de productos de alimentación & retail y productos de alto valor que requieren estrictos protocolos de seguridad.




Precisamos incorporar un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS -Business Intelligence Power BI en nuestras oficinas de Leganés (Madrid)




Responsabilidades:

Exploración de datos, validación de hipótesis, identificación de sesgos, correlaciones y realización de diagnósticos sobre la calidad del dato.
Creación de dashboard e informes en PowerBI para la presentación de resultados a negocio.
Identificar nuevos requisitos de visualización y KPI dentro de los paneles de PowerBI con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades comerciales.
Identificar KPI críticos y evaluar demandas.
Participación en las fases de entendimiento del negocio, trabajando conjuntamente con los Business Owners del proyecto.
Mantenimiento y resolución de incidencias de los Dashboards.




Requisitos:

Grado universitario en Ingenierías, Informática + ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística y Empresa, Física o similares. Se valorará máster o posgrado en Analytics o Big Data.
Background y conocimiento de la herramienta Power BI, incluyendo la capacidad de crear modelos de datos, diseñar informes y paneles, utilizar DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) para crear medidas y cálculos personalizados
Perfil analítico
Inglés: Mínimo C1
Show more

Title: Analista de Datos/Contable con gran Dominio de Excel UCJC
Description:
La Universidad Camilo José Cela busca incorporar a un/a Analista de Datos/Contable con gran Dominio de Excel.

Funciones:

Análisis de datos y elaboración de informes detallados Gestión y depuración de bases de datos.
Creación de modelos y gráficos en Excel para representar datos de manera clara y visual.
Automatización de procesos y optimización de informes utilizando Excel.
Contabilidad de pequeñas empresas del grupo.

Requisitos:

Título universitario en áreas afines (contabilidad, matemáticas, economía u otros).
Experiencia mínima de 3 años en un puesto similar.
Inglés nivel medio.
Dominio de herramientas contables (Business Central) y Microsoft office (especialmente Excel nivel experto: funciones, tablas dinámicas, power Query y Power Pivot…)




Lugar habitual de trabajo: UCJC Villafranca

Tipo de contrato: Indefinido

Jornada completa

Description:

Conocer los procesos del negocio y entender los datos.
Transformar datos en KPIs.
Extracción de datos, creación de dashboards y posterior reporting.

5 años de experiencia en posiciones similares.

Valorable conocimientos en Salesforce.

¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido directamente con el cliente final.
Condiciones salariales atractivas.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Horario intensivo, viernes, julio y agosto.




Si te interesa ¡No dudes en aplicar!

Title: Data Analyst

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

Quantion es una empresa de servicios de transformación digital.

Nacimos el año 2015 con una misión muy clara: crear una propuesta de valor completa para abordar todos los retos de negocio y tecnológicos que surgen en los procesos de transformación de las empresas.




Ofrecemos un modelo de servicio diferencial a través de la cual acompañamos a las empresas para abordar sus proyectos de transformación digital de forma end-to-end:




Estrategia de transformación digital.
Innovation Scouting.
Asesoramiento tecnológico.
Diseño visual y Experiencia de Usuario.
Desarrollo completo de soluciones de negocio con squads especializados.




Buscamos un perfil Data Analyst con 2-3 años de experiencia para ampliar nuestro equipazo.




Requisitos:

Experiencia con Tableau (principalmente) y opcionalmente PowerBI.
Experiencia con Python (Apache Spark), Databricks y Azure.
Experiencia con Google Analytics y Looker Studio (software de visualización de google).
SQL
Kibana (valorable)




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido
Nuestra vida fuera del trabajo es muy importante, por eso tenemos un horario flexible de entrada y salida que facilita el equilibrio entre la vida personal y profesional.
Trabajo híbrido (flexible)
Comprometidas y comprometidos con la igualdad, En Quantion creemos en la diversidad e inclusión. Defendemos la igualdad de oportunidades sin discriminar por género, edad, religión ni orientación sexual o por cualquier otro aspecto que pudiera ser considerado excluyente.
Plan de retribución flexible




Ah, ¡y algo muy importante!:

Además de los 22 días laborables de vacaciones, contamos con una serie de festivos adicionales:

Semana Santa: días comprendidos entre el Lunes Santo y el Lunes de Pascua (ambos inclusive)
Navidad: días comprendidos entre Navidad y Año Nuevo.




Tiempo de sobra para disfrutar de la familia, amigos y del tiempo libre :)

Title: Data analyst - (Remote - Europe/EU)
Description:
Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed, and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search.

For one of our clients, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem), remotely from Europe.

In this role, you will work with a dynamic and innovative team focused on exploring blockchain ecosystems to identify opportunities and risks. Your responsibilities will involve developing end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis to deployment, with a strong focus on optimization, scalability, and performance. You'll provide valuable insights to the team and community through informative dashboards, while also improving validation processes and working closely with the data engineering team. This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of decentralized finance with cutting-edge technologies.

Accountabilities:


Explore blockchain ecosystems, identifying potential opportunities and risks related to Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub
Design and develop comprehensive data solutions, from analysis to deployment, ensuring performance optimization and scalability
Build and maintain informative dashboards for internal teams, the company, and the wider community
Collaborate with data engineering teams to define data requirements, and ensure proper granularity, frequency, and data quality
Manage and govern team data marts, ensuring data lineage and providing actionable insights
Provide ad-hoc support to team members to address emerging data needs



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in advanced SQL (including joins and window expressions) and experience with Google BigQuery
Competence in analytical programming languages such as Python, with experience in the analytical stack
Experience with ETL tools like Airflow and dbt
Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Strong skills in data research, probability theory, and mathematical statistics, including regressions and A/B testing
Proven ability to tell compelling data stories and present your analysis with clear insights
Familiarity with cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is a plus
Proficiency in English (B2+ or higher)



Benefits


Competitive salary, with the option to receive payments in cryptocurrency
Well-being program and mental health care support
Compensation for educational programs, including foreign language courses and professional development
Reimbursement for equipment and co-working spaces
Opportunities to attend overseas conferences and engage with the global community
Positive, friendly, and collaborative communication culture
P2P.org is an equal opportunity employer, offering a diverse and inclusive work environment


Show more

Title: Estudiante en Prácticas Business Intelligence
Description:
En ALAIN AFFLELOU, multinacional del sector de la óptica y la audiología, queremos aumentar nuestro equipo para reforzar el área de Business Intelligence, y ¡queremos conocerte!




Si estás estudiando Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Economía o un campo relacionado, o un Máster en Big Data Science o Analítica, y te gustaría hacer unas prácticas en el dpto. de Business Intelligence, ¡nos encantaría contar contigo! ✨




¿Cómo será tu día?

Apoyarás al equipo de Análisis de Datos a través de:




Preparación y limpieza de datos

- Garantizar la calidad de los datos identificando incoherencias y resolviendo problemas.




Análisis y elaboración de informes

- Realizar análisis básicos de datos para identificar tendencias, patrones y perspectivas.

- Apoyar la creación de informes y cuadros de mando para los equipos internos.




Visualización

- Power BI.

- Presentar los resultados de manera clara y convincente a las partes interesadas o al equipo de BI.




¿Qué buscamos?




- Familiaridad con Excel para análisis de datos.

- Conocimientos básicos de SQL o un lenguaje de programación como Python.

- Interés en herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).

- Inglés fluido.




Te ofrecemos unas prácticas de 6 meses de duración, con una jornada comprendida entre 35h a 39h semanales, en modalidad híbrida (2 días de teletrabajo y 3 días de trabajo presencial en oficina, situada en Paseo de la Castellana,89).




¡Te esperamos! 😊

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Na WINNING CONSULTING procuramos umData Analyst,para se juntar à nossa equipade consultoria, integrando o projeto de um dos nossos clientes no setor Público, em Lisboa - Presencial.REQUISITOS
  • Licenciatura ou formação superior em Engenhariaou Matemática;
  • Domínio de Excel paratratamento e análise de dados;
  • Cerca de2 anos de experiência profissional comprovada;
  • Formação em Gestão de Sistemas de Informação, nomeadamente, Base de dados, através do conhecimento e uso proficiente de Power BI e SQL
  • Idiomas:Português nativo/fluente enível avançado de Inglês(obrigatório)
Quem Somos?A Winning Consulting é uma empresa de consultoria que oferece serviços de consultadoria, formação, recrutamento e investigação. Apoiamos os nossos clientes na procura de soluções inovadoras e sustentáveis, desde a aplicação do conhecimento científico na resolução de problemas complexos de gestão até à transformação digital e tecnológica das organizações.Se quiser saber mais sobre nós, visite o nosso websitehttps://www.winning-consulting.com/Todas as candidaturas são tratadas com confidencialidade ao abrigo do RGPD.Ao subscreveres a tua candidatura, concordas com o tratamento da tua informação no âmbito do recrutamento e na tua inclusão na nossa base de dados de candidatos.Caso não dês consentimento para o tratamento destes dados, pedimos-te o favor de não te candidatares a este anúncio.

Powered by JazzHR

aw4byM4mG4

Title: Data Analyst BI
Description:
Country: Portugal

Formação Base: Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Matemática Aplicada e Computação ou formação equiparada

Competências Requeridas:


Sólidos conhecimentos em exploração e tratamento de dados (ORACLE SQL e PL\SQL, SAS Guide, etc)
Experiência na limpeza e estruturação de dados provenientes de várias fontes, nomeadamente origens não estruturadas
Familiaridade com construção de representações gráficas de dados, através de estatística descritiva e correlações
Preparação de dados para visualização e divulgação a outras áreas da empresa
Criatividade e espírito crítico na busca, interpretação e transformação de dados para utilizações não triviais


Competências Valorizadas:


Experiência académica ou profissional em análises multivariadas, inferência estatística, testes de hipóteses, redução de dimensionalidade, etc
Experiência em ferramentas de visualização de dados, tais como Power BI


Se possuis estes conhecimentos e competências, então esta oportunidade é para ti!

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções.

Vamos dar-lhe o conhecimento e as ferramentas para ser Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Número da Solicitação de Emprego: 88937

Horário: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Data analysis – understand and document the usage of data in the values of the received data formats.
Technical analysis of different data formats received from different data sources.
Use documentation and examples related to data interfaces to understand data structure and provide translation specifications (mappings) from one data format to another.
Identify and document gaps between producing and consuming applications and the Enterprise Data Models based on translation specifications (mappings)
Development and maintenance of documentation
Technical and non-technical stakeholder management (incl. information architects, business change managers, data product owners, data engineers, product owners and tech leads)
Ensure version control and governance around workflow management is followed.
Continuously seek and suggest improvements/optimisations to the process



Our requirements:



Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject
At least 3 years’ experience working in similar role.
Knowledge of TMS systems and data attribute analysis and mapping is advantages
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to talk and present to a range of audiences, facilitating interactions to gain insight into open questions
The ability to work under pressure delivering on agreed deadlines
A good understanding of information technology
Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care

Work-life balance
Culture of feedback

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Responsibilities

  • Work with stakeholders to review and update Bill of Materials (BOMs);
  • Extract and analyze data from SAP, ensuring consistency in receipts and raw materials;
  • Collaborate with the operations team to resolve issues and errors;
  • Improve quality documentation and automate processes where possible;
  • Propose enhancements and test new tools as needed;
  • Generate reports and track key metrics;
  • Ensure on-site presence in Lisbon at least once per week, ideally more.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google solutions;
  • Experience working in an international context, preferably with American stakeholders;
  • Experience in data analysis for industrial areas;
  • Strong project management skills, particularly in IT and change management;
  • Knowledge of Product Stewardship and SAP EHS is a plus;
  • Excellent communication skills in both English and Portuguese.

Title: BI Reporting Analyst
Description:
Overview

As the BI Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for building and maintaining reports and dashboards required across the organization within PowerBI and Salesforce. As part of this role, you will gather requirements from across the organization on reporting requirements, and build out our corporate standardized reporting infrastructure providing accurate, timely, and targeted insights to support data driven decision making. This role will form a central part of our Sales Operations department at HVD Group, where you will be in close contact with leaders, and sellers across the organization, who will rely on you to support them with key insights to their business. This is an exciting opportunity to build and optimize our reporting infrastructure from the ground up, all adding to our hyper growth and expansion across the Nordics and Germany!

Responsibilities


Partner with leadership teams to identify bottlenecks in processes and implement solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop and maintain scalable reporting and dashboarding tools in Salesforce, PowerBI and other business intelligence platforms.
Analyze sales, marketing, and customer success data to provide actionable insights and support data driven decision making.
As a fast growing company, with numerous ongoing acquisitions – develop and support interim, and ad hoc reporting requirements where direct data linkages may not yet exists.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to align efforts, ensuring a seamless end-to-end customer journey.
Lead initiatives to streamline workflows, reduce friction in the sales process, and enhance data quality.
Collaborate with our developers and business systems teams to manage and optimize our Salesforce and PowerBI applications.
Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in revenue



Qualifications


Quantitative degree (Business Intelligence, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar)
2-5 years of experience delivering actionable analytics in a complex, fast-paced environment and/or in a combination of strategy and operations roles preferably related to revenue operations.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with PowerBI reporting and dashboarding.
Ideally with Salesforce reporting / dashboarding experience
Exceptional analytical skills with a proven track record of using data to drive decision-making.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ideally familiarity with SaaS business models and an understanding of sales and marketing operations.



If you share our excitement and vision but worry that your experience doesn't match all the listed qualifications, please apply anyway! You could be the ideal candidate for this role despite lacking a year or two, or perhaps for another role in our ever-expanding organisation We look forward to your application!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Main responsible for Business requirement gathering, User Story writing, and leading User Story refinement / Solution design efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Proactively capture and understand Business processes and suggest improvements to the Data Platform that benefit the organization.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Proven experience with data projects related to accounting, planning and financial analysis domains;
Solid knowledge of data analysis and programming with SQL and Python;
Good knowledge of understanding REST/API SOAP APIs;
Good ability to create prototypes to support requirements in Power BI;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply

This project is remote but you must live in Portugal.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Department: CX Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Fedor Suslyaev

Description

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Customer Experience (CX) Quality Assurance (QA) domain, you will play a critical role in driving data-driven decision-making to enhance the quality of customer support operations. You will analyze data related to agent performance, customer satisfaction (CSAT) surveys, and other key metrics to identify trends, uncover insights, and recommend actionable improvements. Your work will directly impact the quality of customer interactions, agent performance, and overall customer satisfaction.

This role requires a strong analytical mindset, expertise in data analysis tools, and a deep understanding of customer experience metrics. You will collaborate closely with QA teams, customer support managers, and other stakeholders to ensure data insights are translated into effective strategies for improving customer experience.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Reporting:


Analyze data related to agents quality scores, QAs performance, QA queue of tasks, CSAT surveys etc.
Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to visualize key metrics and insights for stakeholders.



Quality Assurance Insights:


Identify patterns and trends in QA data to uncover root causes of quality issues.
Provide actionable recommendations to improve agent performance and customer interactions.
Monitor the impact of QA initiatives and track progress over time.



Collaboration with Stakeholders:


Work closely with QA teams, customer support managers, and training teams to share insights and drive data-informed decisions.
Partner with IT and data engineering teams to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and relevance.



Process Improvement:


Identify inefficiencies in QA processes and recommend improvements to enhance data collection and analysis.
Develop and implement new metrics or KPIs to better measure agent performance and customer satisfaction.



Predictive and Prescriptive Analysis:


Use advanced analytics techniques to predict trends in agent quality and customer satisfaction.
Provide prescriptive recommendations to proactively address potential issues before they impact customer experience.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Work experience as a data analyst for 3+ years.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python.
Experience using Tableau/Metabase or similar data visualization tools.
Experience with using GPT/Claude as a tool for work tasks solving.
A structured approach to problem solving alongside strong quantitative skills. You can analyze issues, identify root-causes and recommend solutions.
Ability to come up with hypotheses and ways to improve our processes: backed by data if possible, but also by your expertise and common sense.
Verbal and written communication skills, an ability to interact with business and product teams.
At least upper-intermediate English proficiency.
