Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:




DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Mission: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to address strategic challenges related to data efficiency, data scoping, and data technology evolution. This role is critical in optimizing our data workflows, enhancing our data cataloging processes, and ensuring the evolution of our IT Datahub in alignment with our reference architecture.




Responsibilities:

Data Efficiency: Minimize manual data entry workflows in IT Datahub; Identify and eliminate unused models and dashboards; Optimize cloud consumption (Cloud FinOps); Implement data purging policies to optimize resources and reuse data models/structures.
Data Scoping & Governance: Enrich IT Datahub by cataloging data in MS Purview, addressing both organic and geographic gaps; Maintain a permanent interface with Data pivots across various geographies; Support the Chief Data & AI Officer in establishing and maintaining data governance frameworks to ensure data quality, compliance, and security.
Data Tech Evolution: Ensure the evolution of IT Datahub according to the reference architecture; Develop a self-service oriented offering (Data Mesh architecture) and streaming capabilities; Manage the transition from the Corporate Datalake to IT Datahub, supporting platforms/regions with IT-managed asset data; Lead the Delivery Solution Architect project with Databricks to optimize processes.
Compiling information/preparing reports to support decision-making.
Creating User Stories for the Data Warehouse.
Data modeling in the Data Warehouse.
Collection of adhoc data from commercial and/or analytical systems.




Required skills:

Up to 10 years' experience in the role for which we are contracting the service;
Knowledge of SQL language, Office tools and in particular Excel at an advanced level;
Analytical and communication skills, interpersonal relationships, creativity, initiative and proactivity are the skills we favor.
Proven experience in data management, data architecture, and cloud optimization;
Strong knowledge of data cataloging tools, specifically MS Purview.
Experience with Data Mesh architecture and streaming technologies.
Proficiency in MS Fabric and Databricks, and cloud platforms.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and the ability to interface with stakeholders across various geographies.
Experience in Cloud FinOps. (Plus)
Familiarity with data purging policies and practices. (Plus)
Knowledge of the energy sector and its data management needs. (Plus)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com, with the reference “CA/DataAnalyst”.




Thank you! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?




Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!




A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.




O que precisas para ser um Data Analyst?




✔ Experiência sólida em SQL para manipulação e extração de dados.

✔ Domínio de Power BI, incluindo criação de dashboards interativos e modelação de dados.

✔ Conhecimentos em DAX e Power Query para análises avançadas.

✔ Experiência na integração de diferentes fontes de dados.

✔ Capacidade analítica e atenção ao detalhe na interpretação de dados.

✔ Boa comunicação para interagir com stakeholders e traduzir requisitos de negócio em soluções analíticas.




Quais serão as tuas funções na SMART?




✔ Criar e otimizar consultas SQL para extrair e transformar dados.

✔ Desenvolver dashboards e relatórios no Power BI para diferentes áreas do negócio.

✔ Implementar modelos de dados eficientes e medidas em DAX.

✔ Garantir a qualidade e integridade dos dados, detetando e corrigindo inconsistências.

✔ Trabalhar em colaboração com equipas técnicas e de negócio para fornecer insights estratégicos.




Porquê ser SMART?




✔ Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.

✔ Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.

✔ Somos simples e eficientes.

✔ Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.

✔ Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.




Onde podes ser SMART?

📍 Lisboa




Tens um perfil SMART? 🚀

Title: Data Analyst BI
Description:
Country: Portugal

Formação Base: Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Matemática Aplicada e Computação ou formação equiparada

Competências Requeridas:


Sólidos conhecimentos em exploração e tratamento de dados (ORACLE SQL e PL\SQL, SAS Guide, etc)
Experiência na limpeza e estruturação de dados provenientes de várias fontes, nomeadamente origens não estruturadas
Familiaridade com construção de representações gráficas de dados, através de estatística descritiva e correlações
Preparação de dados para visualização e divulgação a outras áreas da empresa
Criatividade e espírito crítico na busca, interpretação e transformação de dados para utilizações não triviais


Competências Valorizadas:


Experiência académica ou profissional em análises multivariadas, inferência estatística, testes de hipóteses, redução de dimensionalidade, etc
Experiência em ferramentas de visualização de dados, tais como Power BI


Se possuis estes conhecimentos e competências, então esta oportunidade é para ti!

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções.

Vamos dar-lhe o conhecimento e as ferramentas para ser Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Responsibilities:

  • Work with stakeholders to review and update Bill of Materials (BOMs);
  • Extract and analyze data from SAP, ensuring consistency in receipts and raw materials;
  • Collaborate with the operations team to resolve issues and errors;
  • Improve quality documentation and automate processes where possible;
  • Propose enhancements and test new tools as needed;
  • Generate reports and track key metrics;
  • Ensure on-site presence in Lisbon at least once per week, ideally more.


Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google solutions;
  • Experience working in an international context, preferably with American stakeholders;
  • Experience in data analysis for industrial areas;
  • Strong project management skills, particularly in IT and change management;
  • Knowledge of Product Stewardship and SAP EHS is a plus;
  • Excellent communication skills in both English and Portuguese.

Title: Senior Insight Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

NielsenIQ works with clients to provide insights, thought leadership to drive their business and grow their portfolios. Our work helps our clients set growth strategies and determines what products you ultimately see on the shelf. Our team members are experts across various categories and are viewed as trusted partners by our clients. Analytic Consultants (Senior insights Analyst) within the Customer Success Team are responsible for the execution of projects with limited supervision by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations, and are expected to manage client relationships independently.

Responsibilities


Summarizes data in tables, charts, and graphs; analyzes and interprets sales data and consumer data + basic portfolio knowledge. (edit) Sets-up and refreshes cyclical reports
Prepares and delivers analysis and presentations (category overview as well as issue based) building a story and finalizing conclusions and proposes recommendations. Proposes calculation of Quantified Business Opportunity
Uses internal tools and data sources, coaching Interns and Juniors
Discusses advanced analysis design to best answer client questions with Client Business Partner/client with the support of senior team members, following and fully owning ways of working process
Autonomously interacts with client staff both on basic client needs; leads client meetings and presentations over the phone and in person
Acts in line with the Service level of the client assigned
Catches sales opportunities at client meetings/during analysis


Requirements


Knowledge of and experience working with Consumer Panel Data (CPS) is preferable
Strong client-facing and communication/presentation skills – deliver research results to stakeholders on the client’s side in a clear, consistent manner
Good analytical skills, ability to interpret sales and consumer data
Ability to work independently within a virtual environment
Good interpersonal skills
Organizational skills: understanding of business priorities; ability to adapt to complex and changing organization; ability to manage time schedules
Passionate in FMCG and client dynamics
Good project management skills, specifically for SPOC or Champion roles
Interested in financial and business environment of the clients and the industry
Full proficiency in PowerPoint & Excel
Languages: English - Mother Tongue or Fluent, written and spoke


What we can offer:


Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
Access to learning platforms
Staff and team events


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

  • Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
  • Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
  • Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
  • Access to learning platforms
  • Staff and team events

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

• Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

• Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

• Power BI Experience;

• Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

• Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

• Fluent English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!

We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of “large company” in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.




Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a “Lifetime Experience” where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.

#welcometoyourfuture




What you need to have/know:

Strong knowledge in SQL 🛠️
Proficient in Power BI 📊, Power Query, and M Language 🔄
Expertise in DAX for data modeling 💡




What we expect from you:

Ability to work independently and as part of a team 🤝
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail 🔍
Passion for data and turning insights into action 🚀




What would be a plus (optional):

ETL Development experience 🔄
Knowledge of Python / R 🐍📈
Familiarity with VBA 💻
Advanced skills in Excel 📊




Language Skills:

English (minimum B2 level)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Analyst in Porto, Portugal! 🌍

Who Are We?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.

Where’s the Action?

Our office in Porto – a vibrant hub of innovation and culture, where great things happen every day!

What is my department like?

The Data Analytics team works closely with the Senior Management Team to accelerate data-driven decision-making. At the same time, we empower other teams by helping them work with key metrics and define meaningful visualisations. We are the heart of transforming raw data into actionable insights that fuel business growth!

What is my role like?

As a Data Analyst you will turn raw data into powerful insights! You’ll help shaping data-driven strategies, create impactful visualisations, collaborate with teams to optimise business performance, and design scalable data structures—all while leveraging cutting-edge technologies like Python, SQL, AWS, and Power BI.

What will my daily tasks involve?

✓ Process, model, and create data visualisations using programming languages and analytics technologies, including but not limited to Python, SQL, AWS (Redshift, S3, SageMaker, Glue), Power BI, etc.

✓ Understand the business and how key numbers and KPIs connect day-to-day operations to the company’s future outcomes.

✓ Collaborate with various teams (e.g. Commercial, Management) to identify information needs and support operational areas in optimising business performance through data models.

✓ Define data structure requirements for analytics to help design data flows and processing pipelines.

What is expected from me?

✓ Experience using tools for data cleaning and processing, such as Python, SQL, Git, AWS/GCP/Azure tools, Data Lakes, among others.

✓ Proficiency in data modelling and visualisation using Power BI.

✓ Ability to select and utilise appropriate visualisation models to enhance data interpretation from a business perspective.

✓ Agility in understanding and assimilating business concepts, identifying key challenges, and translating them into technical solutions.

✓ 3+ years of experience, with a passion for and capability in hands-on technical implementation of analyses and models.

What’s in It for You at Clever?

💰 Competitive Remuneration Package – Because you deserve the best!

💊 Health Insurance – Because your health matters!

🎉 Happiness Department & E.A.P. – Holistic well-being and unlimited online psychology sessions with our in-house therapist.

🎂 Birthday Leave – Take the day off — it’s all about you!

🥗 Cafeteria with Healthy Options – We're feeders, sorry!

📚 Continuous Learning Culture– Clever Academy and language classes.


and so much more!


At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed

Ready to make a Clever Choice? 🚀

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid- Porto




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data analysis;
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data extraction;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker);
Experience working with python;
Familiarity with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Snowflake;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Good level of English and Portuguese;
Good level of french is a plus;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a data-driven professional to create dashboards and KPIs for a client in the automotive industry. If you have strong Power BI skills, a sharp analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, we’d love to hear from you!




What will you do?

The data analyst consultant will be responsible for:

Collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data sets.
Conducting statistical analyses.
Collaborating with business teams to identify needs and propose suitable automation solutions.
Ensuring data visualization through BI tools such as Power BI.
Participating in the implementation of best data management practices within the department.




Who are you?

Proven experience as a data analyst in the banking sector, ideally in CIB.
Proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and programming languages (e.g., Python).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation, as well as other languages like DAX, M.
Knowledge of statistical models and predictive modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills to interact with multidisciplinary teams: Business, IT, etc.
Experience in IT-driven project management.
Ability to formalize complex topics.
Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.




Are you ready for this journey?! 🎢




Let's go!!! Apply today or send your CV directly to joel.leite@migso-pcubed.com!




You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project in Porto (twice a week in the office).




Requirements:

• 6 to 9 years' experience

• Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM)

• Ability to write specifications and documentation

• Expertise in Oracle and SQL language

• Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI

• Advanced knowledge of DAX

• Fluent in English (both written and verbal) (mandatory)

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Business Intelligence (BI)!




Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.




Responsabilities:

Developing interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Creating and optimizing queries in SQL Server for data extraction and processing.
Working with DAX for data modeling and metrics creation.
Performing ETL using Power Query.
Ensuring the quality and integrity of the data extracted and presented.
Collaborating with different areas of the business to understand needs and transform requirements into BI solutions.
Implementing good BI governance and security practices within the Microsoft environment.




Requirements:

Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features.
Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, manipulation and data modeling.
Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling.
Mastery of DAX for creating KPIs and custom metrics.
Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query.
Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization.
Analytical skills and the ability to storytell with data.
Good communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas.
Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/BI”




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Show more
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
  • DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
  • DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for an Business Intelligence (BI)!


Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.


Responsabilities:

  • Developing interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI.
  • Creating and optimizing queries in SQL Server for data extraction and processing.
  • Working with DAX for data modeling and metrics creation.
  • Performing ETL using Power Query.
  • Ensuring the quality and integrity of the data extracted and presented.
  • Collaborating with different areas of the business to understand needs and transform requirements into BI solutions.
  • Implementing good BI governance and security practices within the Microsoft environment.


Requirements:

  • Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features.
  • Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, manipulation and data modeling.
  • Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling.
  • Mastery of DAX for creating KPIs and custom metrics.
  • Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query.
  • Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI.
  • Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization.
  • Analytical skills and the ability to storytell with data.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas.
  • Good level of english.


If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/BI”


Thank You! 😊


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f)
Description:
Na CJR Renewables não nos limitamos a produzir energia. Nós somos energia!




A CJR Renewables é uma multinacional que atua no mercado das energias renováveis e orgulha-se de ser uma das empresas líderes mundiais nesta área, oferecendo soluções chave-na-mão.




Presente em mais de 25 países, desenvolvemos soluções EPC para a produção de energia solar e eólica, através do trabalho das nossas equipas que contribuem diariamente com o seu know-how, experiência e dedicação.




Para reforçar a nossa equipa, procuramos um Data Analyst (m/f).




Responsabilidades:

Recolher, processar e analisar grandes volumes de dados para extrair insights acionáveis.
Desenvolver e manter dashboards e relatórios para monitorar métricas de desempenho.
Colaborar com diferentes departamentos para entender suas necessidades de dados e fornecer soluções analíticas.
Identificar tendências e padrões nos dados para apoiar a tomada de decisões estratégicas.
Garantir a integridade e a qualidade dos dados através de processos de validação e limpeza.
Utilizar ferramentas de visualização de dados para apresentar insights de forma clara e concisa.




Requisitos:

Formação superior em Estatística, Matemática, Ciências da Computação, Engenharia ou áreas afins.
Experiência mínima de 2 anos em análise de dados ou funções similares.
Conhecimentos sólidos em SQL e ferramentas de visualização de dados como Power BI, Tableau ou similares.
Experiência com ferramentas de análise estatística como R ou Python.
Excelentes habilidades analíticas e de resolução de problemas.
Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipe.
Fluência em inglês (escrito e falado).




Competências Desejáveis:

Conhecimentos em machine learning e técnicas de modelagem preditiva.
Experiência com big data e ferramentas de processamento de dados como Hadoop ou Spark.
Familiaridade com metodologias ágeis (Scrum, Kanban).
Proatividade e orientação para resultados.




Nos termos do RGPD, informamos que os seus dados serão utilizados única e exclusivamente para o processo de recrutamento a que se está a candidatar. Se desejar retirar o seu consentimento, envie um e-mail para recruitment@cjr-renewables.com.




Política de não-discriminação e igualdade de acesso:

A CJR Renewables promove uma política de não-discriminação e igualdade de acesso.

Nenhum candidato pode ser favorecido, prejudicado ou privado de qualquer direito ou isento de qualquer dever em razão de ascendência, idade, sexo, orientação sexual, estado civil, situação económica, situação familiar, instrução, origem ou condição social, património genético, capacidade de trabalho reduzida, deficiência, doença crónica, nacionalidade, origem étnica ou raça, território de origem, língua, religião, convicções políticas ou ideológicas e filiação sindical.

Nos termos do Decreto-Lei n.º 29/2001, de 3 de fevereiro, deve ser dada preferência aos candidatos com deficiência em situação de igualdade de classificação, substituindo esta preferência as preferências legais. Os candidatos devem declarar, sob compromisso de honra, o seu grau de deficiência, o tipo de deficiência e os meios de comunicação/expressão a utilizar durante o processo de recrutamento.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - ESG Compliance
Description:
The Data Analyst - ESG Compliance will play a critical role in supporting the company’s Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives by supporting data collection, analysis, and reporting processes to help ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.




Core Responsabilities:




Stay up to date on ESG reporting requirements and leading practices through training by reading ESG regulatory guidance, relevant thought leadership and/or ESG webcasts.
Working with ESG Compliance team and Global Finance Country Controllers, and Regional ESG Teams to support the collection, validation, and analysis of ESG data across various business unit to ensure accuracy, consistency and reliability of data and disclosures.
Drive continuous improvement efforts in the ESG reporting processes, systems and data management to streamline and optimize reporting efficiency and accuracy.
Support the develop training programs to educate employees on ESG policies, practices, and data management.
Manage time to meet established deadlines and milestones.
Responsive to business partner requests and foster positive working relationships with Local ESG Process Owners.
Plan and analyze assigned processes
Ensure adherence to all applicable department and professional standards.




Technical Competencies:




Relevant previous work experience in Accounting, Audit and/or the Finance field.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
Strong project management, analytical and problem solving skills.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is fully integrated in the global organization of Natixis, a French multinational financial services firm specialized in Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, Insurance and Payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, Natixis counts nearly 16.000 employees across 38 countries.

Based in Porto, Natixis Centre of Expertise mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank’s business, operations and work culture worldwide, as a key driver of the company’s culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Natixis in Portugal is the best combination of a “start-up mindset” with a large, solid structure. Its unique culture gives true meaning to a “beyond banking” personality: to be a real entrepreneur, self-challenging, ever striving to excel and go that extra mile.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Analyst, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:


Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB.
Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)


You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Analyst, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:


Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies.
Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards.
Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities.
Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.


2- Requirements and Coordination:


Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation.
Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements.
Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.


3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):


Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical requests.
Contribute to the strategic planning of Data Management roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.


4- Monitoring and Collaboration:


Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.


Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localized team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris, with regular interactions with the Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management;
Knowledge in BCBS239 and the respective Streams;
Experienced with Finance / Banking Data (Banking environment, regulations, and products)
Advance expertise in Power BI and Tableau is essential, building automated reports and creating data-driven dashboards;
Knowledge of data transformation and analysis tools (Power Query, DAX, Excel, SQL and Python)
Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).


Soft Skills:


Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.


Only CV´s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specialized in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.

We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

*For this position you need to have residency in Porto.




ARE YOU THE ONE?




We are looking for a skilled data analyst to join our team to enhance our data management and business intelligence capabilities. The role will be responsible for the design and definition of data loading and transformation processes across three key layers: ODS, Data Warehouse and Data Mart. It will be required to carry out rigorous testing during the acceptance phase and to develop a comprehensive understanding of data supply chains to identify and resolve data quality issues. In addition, you will be required to model data in SSAS tabular cubes and Power BI semantic models, guaranteeing the integrity and security of our data flows from source to integration.

Technical Expertise:

Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM).

Ability to write specifications and documentation.

Expertise in Oracle and SQL language.

Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI.

Advanced knowledge of DAX.

Other Skills:

Fluent in English (both written and verbal).




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Show more
HTML:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specialized in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.

We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

*For this position you need to have residency in Porto.


ARE YOU THE ONE?


We are looking for a skilled data analyst to join our team to enhance our data management and business intelligence capabilities. The role will be responsible for the design and definition of data loading and transformation processes across three key layers: ODS, Data Warehouse and Data Mart. It will be required to carry out rigorous testing during the acceptance phase and to develop a comprehensive understanding of data supply chains to identify and resolve data quality issues. In addition, you will be required to model data in SSAS tabular cubes and Power BI semantic models, guaranteeing the integrity and security of our data flows from source to integration.

Technical Expertise:

Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM).

Ability to write specifications and documentation.

Expertise in Oracle and SQL language.

Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI.

Advanced knowledge of DAX.

Other Skills:

Fluent in English (both written and verbal).


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.


Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?

If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.

Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.

Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !

What skills do you need to have?

Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.

4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.

Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.

Availability for occasional travel.

Fluency in English: French is highly valued.

Some of your responsibilities will be: Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.

Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.

Ensure compliance with software governance rules.

Estimate and manage data project tasks.

A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow Up Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red Hours Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.

WHAT DRIVES YOU?

Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at www.redit.pt

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions
Develop data models and algorithms to solve business challenges
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to improve business strategies
Create and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions
Ensure data quality and consistency across all data sources







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques
Ability to interpret and present complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with big data technologies and databases (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Fluency in English (written and spoken)
French – Practice




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you love transforming data into actionable insights?

At MIGSO-PCUBED, we are looking for a data-driven professional to develop dashboards, KPIs for a client in automotive sector. If you have strong Power BI skills, a keen analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate across teams, we want to hear from you! 🚀 Are you our next Data Analyst?


Your key responsibilities:

  • Develop dashboards;
  • Monitor and optimize data processing;
  • Identify opportunities to improve indicators, reports, and processes;
  • Conduct data analysis.


What you bring:

  • Advanced knowledge of Power BI;
  • At least 3 years of experience in dashboard, KPI creation and monitoring;
  • Familiarity with Phyton and SQL;
  • Previous experience in banking sector;
  • Background in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field is preferred;
  • Experience with statistical models;
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills with internal stakeholders;
  • Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
  • Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.


This is an hybrid position based in Porto.


Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join our team! 🔥


You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Junior Data & Analytics Consultant - French Speaker
Description:
Job Description

What to expect, your role


A Data & Analytics Consultant is responsible for supporting the capturing and detailing business processes and needs from our clients, through workshops, meetings, and documentation.
On a daily basis, you will be backing the team in developing data analytics solutions to support the effective operational, tactical and strategic decision making.
As part of this role consultants will be expected to:
Support the development of data solutions in Azure (using technologies such as Synapse Analytics, Fabric) to ingesting various sources into a unified data platform.
Design and deliver scalable PowerBI reports that provide actionable insights for a wide range of clients.


(throughout the L&D programme you will receive training to prepare you for these tasks)

Qualifications


Newly qualified graduates with less than three years’ professional experience.
Degree in Data Science, Analytics, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.
Fluency in English both written and oral.
Fluency in French both written and oral.
Credible client facing personality.
Strong presentation/communication/facilitation skills (oral and written).
Good problem solving and analytical skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office productivity tools.
Knowledge of data systems and SQL (Preference).
Knowledge of BI tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau (Desirable).
Knowledge of programming languages e.g. Python, DAX/M, SQL, C#, R (Desirable).
Good organisational skills.
A strong sense of responsibility and autonomy.
Ability to work independently and well within a team.
Availability to travel abroad.
A demonstrable passion for technology.


Additional Information

What To Expect, Your Benefits


Career development: we assign you a personal Career Development Mentor (CDM) to support. and guide you during your journey with us.
Flexible and friendly work environment (hybrid work model, work-life balance).
Competitive salary.
Health insurance.
25 annual leave days.
Mobile phone and public transport allowances.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Be part of one of the best IT consultancy companies in the world.


Beware of scams

Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) [email protected] domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.

All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing …) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up…)
Build a state of the art industrial “Client Intelligence” solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills – (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
HTML:
What we are looking for

Wiimers are bright, curious, enthusiasts, hard-working individuals together on a mission: delivering expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions to data-intensive industries, by combining business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies. 

This time we are looking for a Analytics Consultant eager to work in projects with a strong focus on  the Energy and Utilities Sector.


At Wiimer you will

Participate in AI & data analytics end-to-end client projects, tackling complex business problems with strategic thinking and creativity, and developing solutions that bring significant business value to our clients; 

Be involved in highly dynamic teams, multi-disciplinary and cross-industry projects (although a strong focus in the Energy and Utilities sector is expected) 

Be in direct contact with the client and be involved in meetings to present results and insights to the client; 

Be responsible for core project activities, including, notably, extraction, transformation and loading of datasets, as well as developing learning algorithms and BI dashboards. 


What you'll need to succeed

  • Degree/master’s in engineering, computer science, information technologies or related field; 
  • Working and/or academic background in the Energy and Utilities Sector (not mandatory, although appreciated); 
  • 3 to 5 years of relevant technical experience in analytics /business intelligence delivering end-to-end projects; 
  • Understanding of machine learning and optimization techniques and algorithms; 
  • Experience in data engineering and ML programming languages (Python and/or R); 
  • Experience in working MLOps tools (e.g. MLflow) (not mandatory, although appreciated); 
  • Experience with Big Data frameworks ( e.g. Azure ML, Databricks, GCP)  and visualization tools (i.e. PowerBI);
  • Experience in SQL programming with data bases, such as SQL Server, MySQL, SQLite, PostgreSQL; 
  • Experience with generative AI tools (e.g. Azure OpenAI and ChatGPT builder) (not mandatory, although appreciated); 
  • Excellent English language skills; 
  • Knowledge in Agile methodology, using tools like Planner, Trello or Jira; 
  • Written and verbal communication skills. 


At Wiimer you will find

At Wiimer, we offer more than just a workplace. You’ll discover a dynamic and collaborative environment, where every day brings new and exciting challenges, working with major clients across various geographies. We prioritize work-life balance, offering a hybrid work model and flexible benefits designed around your needs. And when your birthday comes, it’s time to celebrate – with the day off.

We are committed to your ongoing development, providing access to specialized learning platforms and continuous training opportunities. At Wiimer, we foster an environment where your professional journey and personal development thrive together, all within a supportive, human-centered, and inclusive culture. 

Wiimer is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We foster a diverse culture where individual differences are recognized and appreciated.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn an incentive of €50 for passing the entrance exam by the 9th of October*
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!
