Title: Time Series Researcher | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_01) | Porto, Portugal
Description:
Job Title: Time Series Researcher

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_01

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is looking for an entry-level researcher to join the Intelligent Systems group and specialize in time series analysis, machine learning (ML), and causal AI applied to health data.

As a researcher at AICOS you will work at the forefront of AI innovation, creating purposeful technologies that positively transform industries, promoting social well-being and improving quality of life.

Your Role


Develop and implement advanced time series models to analyse temporal health data, including physiological signals, wearable sensor data, and electronic health records.
Research and develop cutting edge ML techniques to integrate tabular and time series data for health-related applications.
Investigate and apply the latest breakthroughs in causal AI to enhance understanding, prediction, and decision-making in health-related challenges.
Deliver clear and concise reports on developed models and provide proper software documentation.


Your Profile


Academic Master’s degree or equivalent academic qualifications in the area of Biomedical Engineering.
Excellent Python programming skills and experience with data science and ML frameworks (e.g., Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.).
Solid background in ML, deep learning and time series analysis.
Hands-on experience in integrating time series with tabular data to address health-related challenges.
Familiarity with causal AI techniques and their application.
Excellent communication skills in English (technical and business audiences).


We Value


In-depth knowledge of machine learning pipelines (data collection, data labelling, data preparation, model development, model evaluation, model optimization, model deployment and model monitoring).
Experience with time series and causal AI techniques applied to health data, and a willingness to deepen expertise is this emerging field.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Autonomous, dependable, and enthusiast team-player.
Problem-solving, proactive, and critical-thinking attitude.


Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal


People-centric work environment that encourages creativity and the development of new ideas, in which personal and career development go hand in hand.
Opportunity to contribute to stimulating national and international projects spanning through different innovation topics and application areas.
Boost your technical growth.
Make a difference in creating AI solutions that generate value and impact.
Flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home.
Excellent conditions of employment including attractive salary (depending on the academic degree and professional experience), private health insurance plan, access to entrepreneurship programmes.


Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in February 2025.

Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain:


CV – mandatory;
Motivation Letter;
Recommendation Letters are optional but also welcome.


Observation

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of projects:


CardioCausalAI - Exploring Causal AI to Improve Risk Management and Service Delivery in Cardiothoracic Surgery, under Notice No. 04/C05-i08/2024 (Artificial Intelligence, Data Science and Cybersecurity of relevance to Public Administration).
SmILE - Smart Implants for Life Enrichment, under Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2023-STAYHLTH-01-01.

Title: Técnico(a) de Dados Científicos - Porto
HTML:
Pretendemos reforçar a nossa equipa de Operações e Eficiência - Informação Técnico-Científica com um(a) Técnico(a) de Dados

Científicos.

QUEM SOMOS?

O Grupo ANF conta com uma equipa de profissionais de topo, curiosos e proativos e que gostam de desafios. A nossa missão é, todos os dias, apoiar a jornada da Farmácia com soluções robustas e inovadoras e fazer das Farmácias a rede de cuidados de saúde mais valorizada pelas Pessoas.

Acreditamos que o nosso sucesso só acontece porque temos pessoas dedicadas e comprometidas com um grande propósito, o de criar valor no sector da saúde e na sociedade em geral.

O QUE OFERECEMOS?

  • Integração em equipa jovem e dinâmica;
  • Projetos desafiantes e estratégicos;
  • Formação profissional e desenvolvimento de carreira ;
  • Pacote salarial competitivo;
  • Benefícios em vigor na organização.

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:

  • Atualizar e assegurar a manutenção da informação técnico-científica de medicamentos e/ou produtos de saúde e bem-estar em base de dados;
  • Participar em projetos relacionados com informação de medicamentos e produtos de saúde de forma a apoiar as atividades das farmácias, profissionais de saúde e clientes;
  • Contribuir para o cumprimento dos objetivos globais da DOE (Direção de Operações e Eficiência).

O QUE PROCURAMOS?

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado Integrado em Ciências Farmacêuticas;
  • Experiência na gestão de informação de medicamentos e produtos de saúde e bem-estar, análise técnica e regulamentar (valorizado);
  • Capacidade de análise e sistematização de informação;
  • Rigor e compromisso com o resultado;
  • Domínio das ferramentas do Office na ótica do utilizador (valorizados conhecimentos de Excel);
  • Conhecimentos da língua inglesa.

👉 Se és curioso e inovador e ambicionas trabalhar numa organização focada nas Farmácias e na Sociedade, nós queremos conhecer-te. Envia o teu CV e diz-nos qual o teu propósito e o impacto que queres ter na ANF.

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for Personal Data Protection Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Ensure group project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities".
Manage incoming external and internal requests in the outlook inbox CIB GDPR DESK, including Data Subject RightsRequests.
Publish the group GDPR DESK periodic report and manage a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection within group develop and share best practices with the data protection network.




Requirements:

Full proficiency of MSOffice suite Proficiency of project management tools and methodologies.
Language Skills Fluent English (C1-C2).
Excellent writing, communication and interpersonal skills Attention to detail and high sense of rigor and organization.
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts to a senior audience.
Proactiveness and ability to leverage on transversal networks.
Ability to work in a changing environment / Adaptability.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/PersonalDataProtectionAnalyst”




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Analista de Operações e Negócios (m/f/d)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
A KINTO está à procura de um(a) Analista de Operações e Negócios talentoso(a) e motivado(a) para se juntar à nossa equipa em crescimento. Se tens paixão por análise de dados e queres contribuir para a otimização de operações num ambiente dinâmico e inovador, esta pode ser a tua oportunidade!




Os nossos desafios:




- Desenvolver análises detalhadas para otimizar processos operacionais, identificar oportunidades de melhoria e aumentar a eficiência

- Monitorizar e apresentar KPIs para suportar a tomada de decisões estratégicas

- Criar relatórios e dashboards dinâmicos usando ferramentas de Business Intelligence

- Propor e implementar melhorias contínuas nos processos para aumentar a eficiência, reduzir custos e gerir o pricing de serviços

- Participar ativamente na gestão de projetos estratégicos

- Colaborar com equipas internacionais da KINTO




O que valorizamos:




- Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Gestão, Engenharia, Economia, Matemática Aplicada ou áreas similares

- Experiência em funções semelhantes, preferencialmente nos setores de mobilidade, renting, leasing ou logística

- Domínio avançado de Excel e SQL e experiência em criação de dashboards em Power BI ou ferramentas similares

- Capacidade analítica, comunicação eficaz, trabalho em equipa, proatividade e iniciativa

- Fluência em Inglês




O que oferecemos:




- Integração numa empresa multinacional de referência no seu setor de atividade

- Remuneração adequada à função

- Diversos benefícios em vigor e a possibilidade de trabalhar num ambiente descontraído e sempre motivado




Porquê juntares-te à KINTO? Na KINTO acreditamos na inovação e na mobilidade sustentável. Oferecemos um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo, com oportunidades de crescimento e desenvolvimento contínuo. Se procuras fazer parte de uma empresa com impacto global e queres participar na transformação do setor da mobilidade, este é o lugar certo para ti.

Title: Data Engineer w/ French
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • At least 4 years of experience in similar roles;
  • Proficiency in Oracle SQL;
  • Experience in KSH (KornShell) scripting;
  • Hands-on experience with Python development (focused on data handling);
  • Good understanding of CI/CD principles, tools, and automated testing;
  • Cloud experience with containers and Object Storage (COS), including S3-type protocols;
  • Experience working with Docker;
  • Good knowledge of French (minimum B2 level).


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for!


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US 🚀

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations – all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATION🌍

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH 👨🏽‍🤝‍👨🏼

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) – all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO 👩‍💻

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR 👀

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER 💯

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don’t meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Show more
HTML:
ABOUT US 🚀

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations – all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.


LOCATION🌍

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.


WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH 👨🏽‍🤝‍👨🏼

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) – all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

  • Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
  • CDP: Segment
  • CRM: Iterable
  • Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
  • Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
  • Orchestration: Airflow
  • Transformation: DBT
  • Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment


WHAT YOU'LL DO 👩‍💻

  • Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
  • Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
  • Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
  • Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
  • Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
  • Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR 👀

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.


WHAT WE OFFER 💯

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
  • Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
  • A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days


We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don’t meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Remote from Portugal. The candidates must be in Portugal.

The amazing you, will have:


Building processes for extraction, transformation and loading throughout the data lifecycle
Building dashboards using set analysis to give them more flexibility
Monitoring and resolving tickets on the technologies in question
Good communication and interpersonal interaction
Good relationship with different client stakeholders, with the aim of gathering business requirements and monitoring UAT tests
Good command of English Translated with DeepL.com (free version)
QlikSense
Qlik NPrinting




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Information Technology Business Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for an IT Business Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• 4 years minimum of experience working as an IT Business Analyst and having worked on IT projects in Financial Institutions;

• Experience in gathering requirements and creating functional specifications;

• Experience in testing developed functionalities;

• Experience in SQL;

• Experience in Jira and Confluence;

• Previous experience working with Scrum methodologies;

• Fluency in English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).

If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?

If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.

Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.

Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !

What skills do you need to have?

Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.

4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.

Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.

Availability for occasional travel.

Fluency in English: French is highly valued.

Some of your responsibilities will be: Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.

Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.

Ensure compliance with software governance rules.

Estimate and manage data project tasks.

A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow Up Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red Hours Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.

WHAT DRIVES YOU?

Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at www.redit.pt

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions
Develop data models and algorithms to solve business challenges
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to improve business strategies
Create and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions
Ensure data quality and consistency across all data sources







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques
Ability to interpret and present complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with big data technologies and databases (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Fluency in English (written and spoken)
French – Practice




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx) to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation;
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL;
  • +2 years of experience with Alteryx;
  • Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required;
  • Good level of English (mandatory).

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of professional experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Excellent experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics, or Programming


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you love transforming data into actionable insights?

At MIGSO-PCUBED, we are looking for a data-driven professional to develop dashboards, KPIs for a client in automotive sector. If you have strong Power BI skills, a keen analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate across teams, we want to hear from you! 🚀 Are you our next Data Analyst?


Your key responsibilities:

  • Develop dashboards;
  • Monitor and optimize data processing;
  • Identify opportunities to improve indicators, reports, and processes;
  • Conduct data analysis.


What you bring:

  • Advanced knowledge of Power BI;
  • At least 3 years of experience in dashboard, KPI creation and monitoring;
  • Familiarity with Phyton and SQL;
  • Previous experience in banking sector;
  • Background in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field is preferred;
  • Experience with statistical models;
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills with internal stakeholders;
  • Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
  • Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.


This is an hybrid position based in Porto.


Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join our team! 🔥


You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Junior Data & Analytics Consultant - French Speaker
Description:
Job Description

What to expect, your role


A Data & Analytics Consultant is responsible for supporting the capturing and detailing business processes and needs from our clients, through workshops, meetings, and documentation.
On a daily basis, you will be backing the team in developing data analytics solutions to support the effective operational, tactical and strategic decision making.
As part of this role consultants will be expected to:
Support the development of data solutions in Azure (using technologies such as Synapse Analytics, Fabric) to ingesting various sources into a unified data platform.
Design and deliver scalable PowerBI reports that provide actionable insights for a wide range of clients.


(throughout the L&D programme you will receive training to prepare you for these tasks)

Qualifications


Newly qualified graduates with less than three years’ professional experience.
Degree in Data Science, Analytics, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.
Fluency in English both written and oral.
Fluency in French both written and oral.
Credible client facing personality.
Strong presentation/communication/facilitation skills (oral and written).
Good problem solving and analytical skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office productivity tools.
Knowledge of data systems and SQL (Preference).
Knowledge of BI tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau (Desirable).
Knowledge of programming languages e.g. Python, DAX/M, SQL, C#, R (Desirable).
Good organisational skills.
A strong sense of responsibility and autonomy.
Ability to work independently and well within a team.
Availability to travel abroad.
A demonstrable passion for technology.


Additional Information

What To Expect, Your Benefits


Career development: we assign you a personal Career Development Mentor (CDM) to support. and guide you during your journey with us.
Flexible and friendly work environment (hybrid work model, work-life balance).
Competitive salary.
Health insurance.
25 annual leave days.
Mobile phone and public transport allowances.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Be part of one of the best IT consultancy companies in the world.


Beware of scams

Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) [email protected] domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.

All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate.

Title: Data Engineer w/ French
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • At least 4 years of experience in similar roles;
  • Proficiency in Oracle SQL;
  • Experience in KSH (KornShell) scripting;
  • Hands-on experience with Python development (focused on data handling);
  • Good understanding of CI/CD principles, tools, and automated testing;
  • Cloud experience with containers and Object Storage (COS), including S3-type protocols;
  • Experience working with Docker;
  • Good knowledge of French (minimum B2 level).


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for!


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: Data Analyst - EMEA, Multilingual region
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Sales Support Team and drive the next phase of growth and innovation for Foundever’s Multilingual Region. As a Data Analyst, your role will be to work across multiple systems to locate, organize, and correlate unstructured data, ensuring it is maintained and presented accurately. You will analyze metrics, pipeline dynamics, and trends to deliver actionable insights and strengthen our commercial proposals. By working closely with various stakeholders across the region, the analyst will bridge the gap between raw data and impactful narratives, empowering the Sales Support Team and the organization to make informed decisions. This role requires a self-starter who can navigate ambiguity, structure data effectively, and deliver actionable insights that empower the Sales Support Team and the organization at large.

As a Data Analyst, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include

Strategy (non-exhaustive)


Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple systems across 10 countries in the Multilingual Region.
Ensure data consistency and correlation across various dimensions such as but not limited to headcount, languages, verticals, channels, and various other KPIs and benchmarks.
Maintain a structured repository of accurate and up-to-date data for regular access and reporting.
Compare and contrast data from different setups (e.g., B&M vs. WFH) to provide insights into strategy.
Benchmark against industry standards and highlight areas of differentiation.
Analyze pipeline trends and detect discrepancies (e.g., Salesforce data vs. ongoing opportunities).
Perform Lost/Win analyses, deal duration assessments, and revenue impact evaluations.
Provide forecasts and recalculations to reflect pipeline variations and trends accurately.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and narratives that support client proposals and internal strategies.
Create visualizations and summaries that drive understanding and action among diverse stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders across Sales, Solutions, Operations, and other support teams to collect and validate data.
Partner with team members to provide tailored insights and analytics for specific projects or opportunities.
Work closely with the sales and solutions team to ensure that the latest analytics methodologies, case studies, and thinking are being featured in new proposals.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Work closely with internal teams (Reporting, CI, Operations, etc.) to uncover insights and trends.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on the progress and performance of our analytics initiatives and their impact on the business.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have : ‎


Native or proficient level of English (C2) - mandatory
Additional languages are valued
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel - mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Strong analytical and storytelling skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data.
Exceptional organizational skills to manage diverse datasets and ensure consistency.
Ability to work proactively and independently across multiple systems to locate and understand data.
Strong cross-collaboration skills to work effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
Advanced Excel: pivot tables, complex formulas, macros, etc.- mandatory
Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce for pipeline analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint; SharePoint Lists, etc.)
Knowledge of database query languages (e.g., SQL) is a plus.
Exposure to ETL tools/processes is desirable (advanced Excel or scripts like Python or R to mimic ETL processes is a plus).
Availability to work from our office in Porto; Hybrid model after 3 months (40% Work from Home / 60% onsite) - mandatory.
Availability to work 40h weekly - Monday to Friday - 9am to 6pm


Education And Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a sales, operations, or BPO environment.
Experience working with unstructured and multidimensional data sets across different systems
Familiarity with pipeline dynamics and CRM systems (Salesforce experience highly valued).


Other Information

This role may require more than one interview stage and an assessment may be requested during the process.

Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever™

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career. 

Apply today!
Show more

  • Paid professional training

  • Excellent work culture

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US 🚀

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations – all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATION🌍

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH 👨🏽‍🤝‍👨🏼

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) – all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO 👩‍💻

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR 👀

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER 💯

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don’t meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.


WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH 👨🏽‍🤝‍👨🏼

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) – all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

  • Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
  • CDP: Segment
  • CRM: Iterable
  • Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
  • Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
  • Orchestration: Airflow
  • Transformation: DBT
  • Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment


WHAT YOU'LL DO 👩‍💻

  • Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
  • Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
  • Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
  • Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
  • Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
  • Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR 👀

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.


WHAT WE OFFER 💯

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
  • Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
  • A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days


We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don’t meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Remote from Portugal. The candidates must be in Portugal.

The amazing you, will have:


Building processes for extraction, transformation and loading throughout the data lifecycle
Building dashboards using set analysis to give them more flexibility
Monitoring and resolving tickets on the technologies in question
Good communication and interpersonal interaction
Good relationship with different client stakeholders, with the aim of gathering business requirements and monitoring UAT tests
Good command of English Translated with DeepL.com (free version)
QlikSense
Qlik NPrinting




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Engineer (Python)
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Engineer to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry.


You will be joining the Analytics teams of this highly qualified company (Lisbon - Hybrid)


What you will do:

  • Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources;
  • Develop, maintain, and support data pipelines;
  • Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs;
  • Ensure architecture meets business requirements;
  • Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data and added value.
  • Communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders, including data analysts, product managers, and business leaders;
  • Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results;


What you are like:

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus;
  • Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: Power BI + DAX
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?

Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!




A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.




O que precisas para ser um SMART (Business Intelligence)?

• Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Informática de Gestão ou similar.

• Experiência com Power BI e DAX para criação de relatórios e análise de dados.

• Conhecimentos em SSAS, SSIS e processos ETL, incluindo modelação de dados, integração e transformação, garantindo a eficiência e performance das soluções de Business Intelligence.




Porquê ser SMART?

• Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.

• Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.

• Somos simples e eficientes.

• Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.

• Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.




Onde podes ser SMART?

• Porto

Title: Information Technology Business Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for an IT Business Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• 4 years minimum of experience working as an IT Business Analyst and having worked on IT projects in Financial Institutions;

• Experience in gathering requirements and creating functional specifications;

• Experience in testing developed functionalities;

• Experience in SQL;

• Experience in Jira and Confluence;

• Previous experience working with Scrum methodologies;

• Fluency in English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).

If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
